Esta es la única fuente de ingresos en su familia, trabaja junto con su esposo, gracias a sus ingresos se alimentan, pagan sus cuentas, tiene a sus hijos estudiando.

El sueño de ella y su esposo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, tener una vivienda de material (concreto), pagar la educación de sus hijos, ampliar su familia, tener otras actividades como el cultivo o la cría de pollos pero de momento quieren fortalecerse en esta actividad que tanto deben agradecerle.

Luz quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos + alimento, el préstamo le permitirá aumentar sus existencias, ella los criara, engordara y posteriormente venderá, también está mirando la alternativa de iniciar a vender carne en alguna fecha del mes para incentivar la compra de cerdos en la región.
texts.en:
Luz is a 33-year-old woman. She is hard working, responsible, and committed. She is the mother of 4 children, and she lives in a house made of wood and straw. She is dedicated to raising pigs—a very common activity in the area of Momil. Because of its ease of performing, this work has become an alternative form of work for people like Luz who, because of having a family and 4 children, cannot leave to find work because she has to take care of her family.

This is the only source of income for her family. She works with her husband. Thanks to the income, they eat, pay their bills, and give their children an education.

Her and her husband’s dream is to improve their family’s quality of life, have a house made of concrete, pay for their children’s educations, grow their family, and have other activities, such as farming or raising chickens. However, at the moment, they want to get stronger in the work they currently do, which they should be grateful for.

Luz wants to request a loan to buy pigs and feed. The loan will allow her to increase her supply. She will raise the animals, fatten them, and then sell them. She is also looking at the alternative of starting to sell meat at some point of the month to incentivize buying pigs in the area.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed, which will allow her to increase her supply of animals.

loans.name: Suda

texts.en: A hardworking 31-year-old single mother of one child, Suda lives in Kasese, Uganda where she operates a beauty salon business. Suda has a dream of completing her house but lacks the necessary capital. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy construction materials for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her family house.

loans.name: Sophai's Group

texts.en:
Sophai’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Sophai makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 62 años de edad, ella gran parte de su vida la ha paliado sola, se separó de su esposo y se hizo cargo 	de sus 4 hijos ya ellos mayores de edad, les brindo techo, alimentación y educación todo con un trabajo de venta de jugos en el cual empleada hasta 12 horas para sacar la utilidad necesaria para pagar las deudas, en verdad una mujer de admirar por su tenacidad y perseverancia.

Tiene un local, vende principalmente jugos naturales, le añade productos naturales para energía o nutrición, paralelo vende productos para complementar como pasteles, galletas, empanadas las cuales elabora en su casa.

Como ya se esforzó y esmero mucho por su familia, en este momento a sus 62 años de edad quiere perseguir un sueño el cual es la compra de una vivienda propia y tal y como su negocio le ayudo a la cría de hijos, piensa que con este lograra su sueño.

Julia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina y realizar algunas mejoras locativas como lo son pintura, y arreglo de estanterías y vitrina.
texts.en:
Julia is a 62-year-old woman. She has spent most of her life by herself; she separated from her husband and she is no longer caring for her 4 children, since they are adults. She offered them a home, food, and education—all by working to sell juices for 12 hours to make the necessary income to pay her debts. In truth, she is a woman to admire for her tenacity and perseverance. 

She has a store, where she mainly sells natural juice. She adds natural products to the juices for energy or nutrition. In parallel, she sells complementary products, including pastries, cookies, and empanadas, which she makes at home.

As she has already worked and cared a lot for her family, at this time, at 62 years old, she wants to pursue her dream, which is to buy her own house. Since her business helped her raise her children, she plans to also use it to succeed in her dream.

Julia wants to request a loan to buy cooking utensils and to make some improvements to her store, including painting and repairing shelves and display case.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and to make some improvements to her store, including painting and repairing shelves and display case.

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en:
Saroem’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saroem makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 47-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore. 

Her son is a wholesaler for rice - he buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells in Lahore city to retailers. He buys various kinds of rice such as basmati, super kernel, etc. He has been doing this for many years and has many reputable retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantity. In this manner he has built up positive relationships with the retailers, and his customers are also a good advertisement for him. 

With the increase in new customers and demand, he wants to buy rice in bulk so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. Therefore Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy various kinds of rice. In this way he will be able to increase his monthly income and savings, and can properly look after his own children and siblings. 
 
Musarat sends thanks to her honorable supporters, and to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her son in purchasing various kinds of rice.

loans.name: Maria Aida

texts.es:
María, de 40 años de edad, es una de las personas luchadora y soñadora, que a pesar de tener pocos ingresos económicos, ha salido adelante con su familia;  no pudo estudiar, pero si aprendió a leer y escribir en horas nocturnas, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja es albañil.

María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y también trabaja lavando ropa ajan, de sus ingresos y de lo que su pareja obtiene de su trabajo, suplen las necesidades básicas de sus 2 hijos. 

María, necesita el crédito para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que el dinero que tenía no era suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos, específicamente desea poner el techo, ya que se acerca la época lluviosa y no quiere mojarse.

Ella sueña, con tener su casa lista para poder vivir con su familia sin problema alguno y tambien desea ampliar su negocio de tortillas y convertirla en un comedor.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She is a fighter and a dreamer who despite having low economic income has gotten ahead with her family. She couldn't study but learned to read and write at night, Currently she is in a relationship and her partner is a bricklayer.

María works selling tortillas and she also works washing clothes for people. With her income along with what her partner makes from his work they supply the basic needs of their two children.

María needs a loan to make improvements on her house as the money she has will not cover all the costs. Specifically she wants to put on the roof as the rainy season is coming and she doesn't want to get wet. She dreams of having a house with no problems, ready for her family to live in. She also wants to expand her tortilla business and convert it into a cafe.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas, de 61 años de edad, es un campesino muy trabajador, proviene de una familia muy humilde, responsable y de escasos recursos económicos, no pudo asistir a una escuela, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales no estudian, pero lograron graduarse de bachillerato, su esposa es ama de casa y elabora productos artesanales.

Blas, es agricultor, está labor la aprendió por herencia de sus padres.

El necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y agroquímicos para el cultivo.

Sus sueños de Blas, es que sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de continuar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Blas, who is 61 years old, is a very hardworking farmer. He comes from a family who is very humble, responsible, and has few economic resources. He could not go to school. He is married and has 2 children, who do not study, but they were able to graduate from high school. His wife is a housewife and she makes artisanal products. 

Blas is a farmer. He learned this work from his parents. He needs the loan to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for his crops. His dream is that his children will have the opportunity to continue on to study in college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for his crop.

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
Soeurn is 53 years old and a mother of four children, and she lives in Battambang province. 

Nowadays, her family’s living depends on rice farming and working for other farms for a fee, which she has been doing for twenty years. She can earn about 41,900 KHR per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take out a loan with VisionFund to buy seeds and pesticide, and pay labor fees. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide, and pay labor fees

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, ella vive en un humilde hogar el cual lo comparte con su pareja y sus 4 hijos que tienen 7, 11, 11, 3 años de edad, ella ayuda en los gastos del hogar con el dinero que gana vendiendo almuerzos y morcilla, ella sabe de la importancia de su trabajo ya que gracias a este su humilde hogar está equilibrado, no son las personas con más dinero  pero no pasan necesidades.

Ella junto a su esposo se ha propuesto una meta y es que ambos aportaran como buenos padres que son para que pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y en lo posible ir invirtiendo en modificaciones para su vivienda, como tener un piso de cerámica, revocar y pintar paredes, comprar una sala, televisores led, camas nuevas, tener una cocina integral, muchos deseos que con trabajo y espíritu de lucha conseguirán a un futuro.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar sus insumos principales que son carne de cerdo, maíz, leña y condimentos.
texts.en:
Amalia is a 31 year old woman. She lives in a humble house which she shares with her husband and four children aged 7, 11, 11 and 3 years old. She helps with the household expenses with the money that she makes selling lunches and blood sausage. She knows the importance of her work as it is thanks to this that her humble home is stable. They are not the people with the most money but they don't go without either.

She together with her husband have proposed a goal. Which is for both of them to contribute as the good parents they are, to pay for the education of their children, improve the quality of living of their family and as much as possible invest in improvements to their house. They want to install tile floors, plaster and paint the walls, buy a living room set, a LED television, new beds and a complete kitchen. Many desires that with work and a fighting spirit they will achieve in the future.

She wants to request a loan to buy her main supplies which are pork. corn wood and condiments

loans.use: to buy her main supplies like pork meat, corn, wood and condiments.

loans.name: Naier

texts.en:
Naier is a 50-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Naier's son has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Naier wants to grow the business of her son, so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan, so her son can buy more stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. 

Naier is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, and she in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. 

She is very thankful to Kiva field partner's BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
A resident of Kasese, Uganda, Stephen is a 33-year-old married father of four children, all of whom are attending school. He owns a retail shop selling general merchandise and earns additional income from crop farming and a salon business. 

Stephen has a dream of improving his family's standard of living and expanding his business. However he is faced with a challenge of limited capital hindering his business growth. He is therefore requesting this loan to buy sugar, salt, soap, soft drinks and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, soft drinks and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For dental treatment.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana lives in Saratak village in the Shirak region with her husband, elderly retired mother-in-law, brother-in-law and two little kids (2 and 6 years old). 
This family's only occupation is farming. The farm which they run isn't big, but they are working hard to develop and expand it. The family keep three cows and three calves, and they also cultivate wheat, potato and beet.
 
Liana has applied for this loan to purchase potato and wheat seeds, and fertilizer (13 packages) needed for land cultivation. Because the region where Liana's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Liana's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato and wheat seeds, and fertilizer (13 packages) needed for land cultivation

loans.name: Fidel Jose

texts.es:
Con coraje, sueños por cumplir, algo de susto el joven Fidel de tan solo 21 años de edad enfrentara una nueva etapa en su vida, él una persona dedicada al campo quiere emprender y buscar su camino en la cría de cerdos, una actividad que conoce muy bien gracias a sus padres.

Fidel quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su negocio de cría de cerdos, la razón es que en su hogar han pasado por necesidades y para él es frustrante ver a sus seres queridos en estas condiciones por ello tomó la decisión de apoyarlos en todo lo que pueda, con su negocio tendrá una buena entrada para ocuparse de unos gastos, esperando que su negocio sea un éxito y pueda mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Por ello pide a todos un apoyo para la compra de cerdos y adecuación de un espacio donde construiría unas cocheras, tu préstamo le dará las herramientas a un joven para ayudar a su familia y lo hará en base a trabajo y esfuerzo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y les agradece por el apoyo que le puedan dar.
texts.en:
With courage, dreams to make come true, and a little bit of fear, the young Fidel – who is only 21 years old – will enter into a new stage of his life. He is a person who is dedicated to the land, and he wants to learn and find his way in pig breeding. This is an occupation that he is very familiar with, thanks to his parents. Fidel wants to request a loan to start his pig breeding business, the reason being that in his home they are going through some hard times. For him, it is frustrating to see his loved ones in these conditions. For this reason, he made the decision to support them in any way he can. His business will be a good start and will let him take care of some expenses. He his hoping that his business will be a success and he can improve his family’s living conditions.

To accomplish this, he is asking everyone for this support to buy pigs and for the adaptation of a space where he will build some pens. Your loan will give a young man the tools to help his family, and he will do it using his work and strength. He promises to make the payments punctually and he appreciates the support that you can give.

loans.use: to start his independent life, and to build pens that he will fill with pigs.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristobal tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad habitada por personas amables que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha, con esto Cristobal espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 32 years old, lives with his spouse and their 2 children in the district of Cañaris, a community of friendly people who mainly make their living in agriculture and ranching. It is located in the province of Ferreñafe, in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Perú.

He makes his living in agriculture, specifically in coffee cultivation, and this has been his occupation for the last 10 years. Consequently, he has experience in this business and his neighbors give very good personal and work references for him. 

He will use the loan to purchase compost and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop as well as to contract manual labor during the harvest. With this Cristobal hopes to provide a better quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact in the level of his income and will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to maintain his crop, as well as to contract manual labor during the harvest.

loans.name: Shirley Piedad

texts.es:
Shirley una dama de 36 años de edad, ella es una madre cabeza de familia, tiene dos hijas una de 16 y otra de 14, ella afronto un periodo muy difícil en su vida y fue el fallecimiento de su esposo, un golpe que sufrió no hace mucho  y del cual está tratando de reponerse. 

Ella hubiera querido tiempo para reponerse pero las deudas, la necesidad de comer y salir adelante junto con sus dos hijas era apremiante, por ello en el año 2013 inicio con un negocio de cría de cerdos que es la profesión que tenía mayor conocimiento ya que sus padres se la enseñaron.

Conforme va pasando el tiempo Shirley se va fortaleciendo su empresa, ahora quiere hacer una apuesta por el progreso y aumento de producción por ello quiere apoyarse de un préstamo para realizar esta operación.

Con el préstamo solicitado quiere construir una cochera nueva, comprara los materiales que son; zinc, tubos, cemento, también comprara cerdos y alimento.

Tu apoyo será muy importante, marcara el progreso y el aumento de producción de la empresaria.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 36 year old woman. She is a mother and the head of her family. She has 2 daughters, one who is 16 and another who is 14. She recently faced a very difficult period in life because her husband died of a stroke. She is trying to recover from this period. 
She had wanted time to recover but debts, the need to eat, and the need to move forward together with her 2 daughters made things urgent. So, in 2013 she began her own business raising pigs, which is the profession that she knows best as her parents taught it to her. 
As time goes by, Shirely is strengthening her business. Now she wants to make a commitment to increase production and so she wants the support of a loan to make this happen.
She will use the requested loan to build a new sty, and to buy the materials: zinc, pipes, and cement. She will also buy pigs and feed.
Your support will be very important. It will indicate the progress and expansion of production for this businesswoman.

loans.use: to build a new sty and buy materials: zinc, pipes, and cement, and to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Un préstamo representara la oportunidad para que una familia salga adelante, una familia como la de Lina quien es un ama de casa de tan solo 25 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años de edad, que vive con su esposo en un humilde hogar y que con el préstamo montara un negocio de cría de pollos de engorde, que nace de una necesidad latente de generar recursos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, puesto que sus hijos están creciendo hay más gastos, la comida está cara,  la educación, el pago de renta.

Lina ve la situación en su familia y quiere hacer algo, quiere ayudarlos apoyarlos pero debe cuidar a sus hijos, esto al imposibilita a salir a buscar un trabajo por ello quiere aprovechar el espacio que hay en la vivienda para iniciar el negocio, comprara pollos, maíz, alimento de engorde, comprara madera y cercas para construir los estaderos, igual que tejas para protegerlos del frio, un sistema de riego y bombillas para mantenerlos a una temperatura ideal.
texts.en:
This loan will serve as an opportunity for a family to get ahead – a family like Lina’s. Lina is a housewife and is only 25 years old. She is the mother of 3 children of ages 9, 7, and 4. She lives with her husband in a humble home. With the loan, she will start a broiler chicken breeding business. She is doing this due to an unrealized need to generate resources to improve her living conditions. Her children are growing and they have more expenses. Food is expensive, as is education, and paying rent.

Lina sees her family’s situation and wants to do something. She wants to help them by supporting them, but she needs to take care of her children. This makes it impossible for her to go out and look for a job, so she wants to take advantage of the space they have in the home to start the business. She will buy chickens; corn; feed to fatten them; wood and fences to build the pens; roof tiles to protect them from the cold; and an irrigation system and light bulbs to keep them at an ideal temperature.

loans.use: to start a poultry raising business to improve her family’s situation.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, who is a 33-year-old young man, lives in the village of Jandara. He has a wife and a pensioner mother-in-law. 

With the help of his wife, Samir is involved in agricultural activity and gets income from making and selling brooms at the local market. They work hard to make a good living condition for their family and tackle the financial difficulties. 

Samir decided to start an additional family business and more effectively meet all family expenses. He sought credit among local financial institutions and after several unsuccessful attempts, his loan request was approved within the startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, and enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

Samir and his wife will purchase a stock of various kinds of clothing and start selling in their community. They already have a big list of loyal costumers and the new business will be an additional profitable activity for them.

Samir and his wife rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To start trading in clothing to make additional family income

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha, 62, is a mother of six children, living in Battambang province. 

Growing cassava and working on others' farms for fees have been the sources of her family’s income for ten years. 

Now she is leading a group of two to take a loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, to buy seeds and pay the plowing fee for the farm. 

She hopes to earn more money and ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Ludis Esther

texts.es:
Ludis es una mujer que vive su época de oro, tiene 50 años de edad, es trabajadora, emprendedora, amoroso y muy dedicada, ella trabaja en un negocio de confección a terceros, maquilando para otras empresas, sus trabajos son de calidad, pero debido a la fuerte competencia este modo de vida en ocasiones es mal pago y necesitas de mucha mercancía para sacar buena utilidad.

Ludis ante esta situación busca alternativas, una de ellas y quizás la más viable es aprovechar sus conocimientos en confección y sacar una línea de ropa interior y pijamas, también colocara un cartel ofertando servicios de sastrería.

Con estas ideas busca mejorar sus entradas de dinero y así ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de familia.

Ella tiene un motivo muy grande por el cual desea crecer, no es avaricia, lujos solo es cumplirle el sueño a sus dos hijos de asistir a una universidad.
texts.en:
Ludis is a woman in her golden age. She is 50 years old, hardworking, enterprising, loving, and very dedicated. She works in a business making clothes for third parties to sell. Her work is high quality but, due to the strong competition, is sometimes badly paid and she needs to make a lot of merchandise to make a good profit. 
Before starting this work, Ludia looked for alternatives. One of those, and perhaps the most viable, is to take advantage of her knowledge of tailoring and launch a line of underwear and pajamas, and also to offer tailoring services. 
With these ideas, she is looking to improve her income and also to help to improve her family's quality of life. 
She has an important motive for wanting to grow, and it is not avarice or wanting luxuries. She just wants to realize her dream of sending her children to university.

loans.use: to launch a line of underwear and pyjamas, and also to offer tailoring services.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food and health.

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has a few years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her first loan cycle with BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 2 years.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, cooking fat, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, and other items.

Her business goal is to be able to import products to sell within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. She also operates an M-pesa business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria, de 67 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tiene 5 hijos, todos viven aparte.

Gregoria, se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar, mientras su esposo sale a sembrar granos básicos como maíz y frijol. 

Gregoria, necesita el crédito para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara maíz y el frijol, con esta cosecha asegurara la alimentación para él y su familia.

Gregoria, sueña con tener una casa de bloque y con estructura de hierro, pues la casa en donde vive actualmente es de bahareque, las paredes de madera y tejas de barro.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 67 years old. She did not go to school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has 5 children, who all live elsewhere. 
Gregoria does the housework while her husband goes out to grow staple crops such as corn and beans.
Gregoria needs the loan to pay the rent on the land where they grow corn and beans. With this harvest, her husband will secure the food for himself and their family.
Gregoria dreams of having a house made of cinderblocks and iron as the house where she currently lives is made of wattle and daub, with wooden walls and earth floors.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where she grows corn and beans.

loans.name: Beatriz Estela

texts.es:
Ella es Beatriz, una ama de casa, madre de un niño de 9 años de edad, felizmente casada y que está dando sus primeros pasos como emprendedora, ella quien estaba buscando la forma de montar un negocio junto todos sus ahorros y monto una tienda de abarrotes, con la convicción y la decisión de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, la empresa la inicio a principios del mes de febrero con un único propósito comprar una vivienda propia, se cansó de pagar arrendamiento, de pasar necesidades y ahora está en sus manos mantenerse en el mercado, capturar clientes y el futuro de su hija.

Como invirtió todo el dinero que tenía para montar el negocio se quedó sin presupuesto para surtir el negocio, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar abarrotes, granos, productos lácteos, papas en bolsa y productos de aseo, el préstamo será una excelente ventaja para ella ya que tendrá surtido para vender y un historial crediticio para futuros prestamos, piensa a futuro es una mujer decidida que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This is Beatriz, a housewife, mother of a 9 year old son, happily married, and making her first moves as an entrepreneur. She was looking for a way to start a business using all her savings, and started a grocery store. She did this to improve her family's quality of life. She started the business at the start of February with the goal of buying a house as she is tired of paying rent. Now staying in the market, securing customers, and the future of her child are all in her hands. 
As she invested all the money that she had in starting the store, she found herself without the budget to stock the business. So, she wants to request a loan to buy groceries: grains, dairy products, potato chips, and cleaning products. The loan will be a great advantage for her as she will be able to stock-up to make sales and will have a credit history for future loans, thinking to the future. She is a dedicated woman who promises to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries: grains, dairy products, potato chips, and cleaning products to supply her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 52-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past several years to support her family. She beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. 

By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also works in a factory but earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide all facilities to her family. To cope with increasing demand, she has requested a loan to purchase a stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, buttons, and pearls of various colors. She hopes to increase her earnings through her large sales. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has an excellent repayment record. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Naseem thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, buttons, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a quality life. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Corazon De Santa Maria Group

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 45 años de edad, convive con el Sr. Nicolai con quien tiene 3 hijos que todavía dependen de ellos, tiene el cargo de presidenta en la alcancía comunal “CORAZON DE SANTA MARIA” conformada por 6 mujeres muy responsables con muchas ganas de salir adelante. María tiene como fuente de trabajo una pequeña bodega en su casa y adicional a ello realiza servicios de costura en su propio taller que ella misma implemento gracias al apoyo que viene recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA, de esta forma la calidad de vida que lleva su familia sigue mejorando. El préstamo lo invertirá exclusivamente en surtir más productos para su bodega y taller de costura. Uno de los sueños de María es seguir creciendo en sus negocios y la profesión de sus hijos. En la foto del grupo María es quien se encuentra de pie junto a las demás socias sentadas.
texts.en: María is 45 years old. She lives with Nicolai, with whom she has 3 children who are still dependent on them. She serves in the role of president of the loan group Corazon de Santa María, which is comprised of 6 women who are very responsible and have a great desire to succeed. María's source of income is a small store in her home and, in addition to this, she offers dressmaking services from her own workshop that she started thanks to the support that she received from the Kiva lenders. Because of this, her family's quality of life has improved. She will use the loan exclusively to stock her store with more products and for her dressmaking workshop. One of María's dreams is to keep growing her businesses and her children's professions. In the photo of the group, María is on foot and the other members are seated.

loans.use: to buy products for her store and her dressmaking workshop.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 36-year-old engaged Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, in addition to their limited job access, he started five years ago working as a taxi driver to cover the needs and expenses of his future family.

Mostafa is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop his business; thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain his taxi car, which is his only source of income. This loan is very important to Mostafa, for it will help him prepare for his marriage and future family.

Mostafa hopes to develop his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of satisfying his needs.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi car, which is his only source of income.

loans.name: Kennedy Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Kenedy es un hombre muy trabajador y carismático, se dedica al  alquiler de lavadora y venta de alimentos (chuzos), este negocio le ha permitido elevar su calidad de vida, le permite soñar, esperanzarse con una mejor salida, aunque parezca poco para el pasar de vivir solo con lo justo a poder tener un negocio propio, su hijo estudiando, comer bien, tener sus cuentas al día es muy gratificante y motivo de orgullo.

Tuvo muchos tropiezos antes del año 2009 cuando decidió volverse independiente, pasando de empleo en empleo peor con este negocio ha estado firme y quiere seguir creciendo porque ve la oportunidad y se alegra saber que la necesidad nació de sugerencias de los clientes, quienes le pidieron que aumentara su capacidad ya que se sienten muy contentos de trabajar con él.

Por tal razón Kenedy se enorgullece de solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de 3 lavadoras y carne para realizar sus chuzos, este préstamo marcara el cambio y progreso en la vida de un empresario y tú puedes ayudarlo, anímate presta ¡!
texts.en:
Kennedy is a very hardworking and charismatic man. He makes a living by renting washing machines and selling food (shish kabobs). This business has allowed him to improve his quality of life. It allows him to dream and hope for better results. Although it may not seem like a lot, for him, to go from living with just the bare necessities to having his own business, having his child studying, eating well, and having his bills up to date is very gratifying and makes him proud. 

He had many setbacks before 2009, when he decided to become independent. He was going from job to job, each one worse than the other. With this business, he has been stable and he wants to continue growing because he sees the opportunity. It makes him happy to know that the need came from suggestions from his customers. They asked him to expand his capacity, since they are very happy working with him. For this reason, Kennedy is proud to request a loan that he will invest in buying 3 washing machines and meat to make his shish kabobs. This loan will signify a change and progress in the life of an entrepreneur, and you can help him. Let’s go and lend!

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines and meat to make his shish kabobs.

loans.name: Inn Ga Lone Village Group 3

texts.en:
The funds will help 18 members from Inn Ga Lone group-3. Pictured above are the CBO members, named (from left to right) Zar, Khin, Thente, Nyunt and Nge. The featured borrower, Thente, has five acres of crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. The loan will help her purchase the necessary farming resources she needs before harvest.

Thente is thirty-six years old and married. She is proud to be a farmer because she believes as a rice farmer she is serving good for the society, even though she has to face challenging difficulties in rice farming such as not having enough capital. From the profits, she hopes to save some money for her mother’s health care for the future.

The CBO leaders oversee a group of eighteen borrowers in the village. The funds will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Inn Ga Lone Village mainly focuses on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantations such as betel leaves and flowers, for additional income.

loans.use: to rent farm equipment and purchase fertilizers and petrol for farm equipment.

loans.name: Mengsim's Group

texts.en: Mengsim, 34, is the mother of two children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice and working on other farms for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years and it earns her about 57,600 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay the plowing fee. She wishes to gain more yield and the ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Myi Ni Gone Village Group

texts.en:
The fund will help 30 village customers. Pictured above are the members from Myi Ni Gone Village, named as Thaung, Thin, Nwe, Thae and Cho.  Thaung (second from left), the featured borrower, is 46 years old and married with a child. He owns 11 acres of a crop farm and as well plants betel leaves and beans. He used to raise ducks for savings. 

Proximity loans will help Thaung to purchase fertilizer and gas for cropping machines. This year's crop goal for Thaung is to increase the development and improvements vs. last year. He has been in the crop farming business for over 25 years. Thaung's life goals are to be rich and have his his child educated.
 
Myi Ni Gone village is located in Ayeyarwaddy River in Myanmar Delta Region, and the group has five CBO members overseeing 30 village customers. The village has a population of over 900, and mainly focuses on crop farming. As a secondary business, the villagers plant seasonal vegetables and raise livestock.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farming equipment

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows bananas, maize and sugarcane. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of farm inputs. 

Jane will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Inn Ga Lone Village Group-4

texts.en:
The fund will help 29 members of the Inn Ga Lone Village Group-4. Pictured above (from left to right) are Than, Hla, Tun, Ohmar and Chine. The featured borrower, Than, has a 13-acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. Also, additional income generated from these loans will help build secondary businesses for Than, as she is planning to do a betel trees plantation for the next season. Than is 56 years old, married, and supports a family of nine (seven children), the youngest of whom is in 5th grade. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the childrens’ education.

The CBO leaders oversee the group of 29. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Inn Ga Lone Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as betel trees and flowers for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment and buying crop seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of keeping cattle and farming whereby he largely grows bananas plus poultry keeping. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital that hinders progress of his business. However, Richard has future hopes of having a uniform monthly income and opening new markets for his business of poultry. 

Richard needs a loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a hard-working married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells second-hand clothes and at the same time does farming growing bananas. His retail shop adds more income. He faces the challenge of little capital to buy enough inventory for his business. Besides that, he has hopes of having enough capital to boost his business to new areas in order to obtain more profits. Richard has asked for a loan to buy clothes for selling. He used the previous loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with four children. For the past 20 years, he has operated a restaurant. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. James describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough utensils in the restaurant. He describes himself as focused. 

James is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to renovate his restaurant and buy utensils. This will be his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans. James hopes to improve his family’s living standards in the future. His business goal is to have more restaurant branches within five years.

loans.use: to renovate his restaurant and buy utensils

loans.name: Stephenson

texts.en: Stephenson is a 32-year-old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a motorcycle transport business and at the same time does farming that adds more profits. He faces challenges of low capital on top of bad roads that are almost impassable during the rainy season. That hinders the progress of his business. He has future prospects of having a good monthly income for his family. He has asked for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy  a new motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Shabana's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.

Shabana's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw, so Shabana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. Shabana and her husband thank Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase a new rickshaw for transportation services.

loans.name: Ky School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Muhammad. He is the head teacher of Ky Day & Boarding Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 1,300 students. 

Ky School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Ky School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Muhammad ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en: Nona is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives in the Senaki district with her husband and 2 children. The only source of income for the family is her husband's monthly salary from working at the local police department. Nona is unemployed and looks after her children. She decided to start a business in order to increase the family's income. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and will resell them with a price markup. Nona awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a clothes-selling trade

loans.name: Illis

texts.en:
Illis is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be less space on the premises. 

Illis will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials to create more space to keep more stock. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to create more space to keep more stock

loans.name: Vepkhvia

texts.en:
Vepkhvia is 43 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and two children. Vepkhvia is involved in agricultural activities and has two cows, three calves, and two pigs. In addition, he has a small vineyard and nut trees. Vepkhvia works hard to ensure a good harvest. He also earns a minibus which is currently not usable.

Vepkhvia is requesting a loan to renovate his minibus and transport local people. Through the Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, he will access a 4,600 GEL loan. His loan will give him a chance to get stable income. Vepkhvia awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate his minibus and transport local people

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona farmer from Mayere Umbo Vilage. He joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through an input loan with Babban Gona, Dauda will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds. His loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare which is double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Dauda has made it his personal goal to ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds

loans.name: Soku

texts.en:
Soku is 37 years old, married to Robina, and he supports five family members. He has been a barber for the last eight years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase a Kinyozi machine for hair cutting so as to meet his family needs and those of his clients. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a Kinyozi machine for hair cutting so as to meet his family needs and those of his clients.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a married man with two children. For the past five years, he has operated a business transporting customers using his motorcycle. Tom’s business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. His biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. Tom describes himself as focused. 

Tom is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. This will be his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loans successfully. Tom’s business goal is to expand and buy a matatu within five years. He hopes to improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Benardus

texts.en:
Benardus is a married man with two children. For the past seven years, he has made furniture. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all types. Benardus describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. He describes himself as honest. 

Benardus is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy more materials to make furniture. This will be his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Benardus repaid his previous loans successfully. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. Benardus hopes to improve the quality of his life in the future.

loans.use: buy materials to make furniture

loans.name: Medardo Manuel

texts.es:
Medardo es una persona de 52 años de edad, residente de la zona de Chinu y se dedica a la cría de aves un negocio que aprendió de sus padres y con el gana el dinero para el sostenimiento de su familia que la conforma su pareja y 4 hijos.

Medardo se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento, la razón del préstamo es que necesita abastecer sus galpones para tener el equilibrio de ventas que venido mostrando.

La razón del crédito nace de una necesidad de invertir, las ventas han estado bajas, para ajustar las condiciones climáticas le han valido varias muertes de pollos, algunos se mueren por enfermedad y otros simplemente se los roban, son circunstancias que tiene que manejar con madurez y el sabia del riesgo y lo quiso afrontar, de momento no tiene capital por ello solicita el préstamo, se compromete a pagarlo puntualmente.

Ayuda al señor Medardo a superar esta dificultad, el trabajara y luchara pro el futuro de su familia en base a su negocio y nos e detendrá hasta que sea el propietaria de la principal pollera de la zona de Chinu.
texts.en:
Medardo is a 52-year-old person who lives in the Chinu zone and makes a living by raising poultry. By doing this, he makes money for the sustenance of his family, which is made up of his partner and 4 children. 

Medardo is requesting a loan, which he wants to invest in buying chickens and food. The reason for the loan is that he needs to fill his barns in order to achieve the same level of sales that he has had thus far. 

The reason for the loan comes from a need to invest. His sales have been low. The change in climate has caused the death of various chickens. Some die due to illness, and others are simply stolen. These are circumstances that he has to manage with maturity. He knew the risk and wanted to face it. At the moment, he doesn’t have capital. For this reason, he is requesting the loan. He promises to pay it punctually. 

Help Medardo overcome this challenge. He will work and fight for the future of his family through his business, and he will not stop until he is the owner of the leading poultry business in the Chinu area.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food to stock his barn.

loans.name: St Thereza Women Group

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old and married with four children; three of them go to school.  He is a member of St Thereza Women Group, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Alex is an electrician who wires houses and owns an electrical shop. He has been in that business for eight years, and has managed to raise school fees for his children. He has a dream of educating his children to university; hopefully they get jobs and earn a living. 

Alex is faced with a challenge of market competition. 

Alex wants money to buy electronics such as wires, bulbs, extension cables and others for selling.

loans.use: to buy electronics such as wire, bulbs, extensions and others for selling.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with three children and all attend school. He rears cattle and supplements his income by driving a car for transport. He dreams of completing his house despite being disturbed by cattle diseases like foot and mouth disease. He is seeking credit to buy more cows to raise.

loans.use: to buy more cows to raise.

loans.name: Luntha Group

texts.en:
Memory thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to expand her business by buying different commodities that were not in stock in her grocery store. The profits gained from her business have helped Memory to financially support her family.

Memory would like to get another loan, in order to diversify her business, as she wants to start selling second-hand clothes. She opted for this business as it is highly demanded in her area. She plans on sending her children to private schools and hopes to build a better house for her children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar solution for his business, allowing him to uplift his income

loans.name: Nyaung Ngu Village Group 1

texts.en:
The funds will help 22 members from Nyaung Ngu group 1 Village. Pictured above are the members from the group, named Kyaw, Dar, Than, Aung and Nyaung, and Kyaw (second from left) is the featured borrower. Kyaw is 68 years old and lives with a family of seven. Kyaw is a proud father because all of his four children are independent and working by themselves. He farms on his 15 acres of crop farm and the loan will help him purchase supplies for the farm such as fertilizers and gas for machines. Even though crop farming is tiring, U Kyaw thinks its beneficial as it can be sold and donated to monasteries as well. He got this crop farm as a heritage from his parents and has been in the business over 10 years.

Nyaung Ngu Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy River, Myanmar Delta Region and the village has over 1000 villagers. Most men focus on crop farming and as well plant flowers and betel leaves. Some households also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs for savings.

The five CBO members oversee a group of 22 village customers. The funds will help some group members to purchase fertilizers and gas for farming equipment and to pay an allowance to daily laborers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and gas for farming equipment.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rainfall, which affects transport. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a motor vehicle within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Luz Estella es una madre de familia, tiene 3 hijos, dos mujeres de 17 y 15 y el pequeño de tan solo 3 años de edad, es una mujer madura tiene 38 años de edad, es muy centrada en su trabajo, para ella es primordial y prioritario al educación y atención a sus hijos, pero en su hogar son personas humildes en donde necesitan que tanto padre como madre trabajan para poder pagar las cuentas.

Luz Estella tiene un negocio en su hogar de confección, ella tiene una maquina donde oferta sus servicios a terceros de igual manera realiza costuras o prendas por pedido, en el momento la confección no le está dejando mucha utilidad por ello quiere buscar alternativas para ganar más dinero que le permita seguir mejorando su calidad de vida que se ve reflejado en la alimentación, en lo que visten, en su hogar, incluso en su negocio.

Su idea es mejorar ventas, atraer clientes, lograr sostenibilidad, ofrecer algo nuevo y lo quiere hacer iniciando una ventura con una línea propia de blusas y camisas que ofertara en su casa y primeramente a amigos y vecinos o clientes que se arrimen, esta es su estrategia para tratar de ganar mayores recursos pero tiene un pequeño inconveniente y es el alto costo de insumos.

Luz quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de telas, el insumo principal para elaborar sus prendas.
texts.en:
Luz Estella is a 38 year old mother to three children, two daughters ages 17 and 15 and a son only 3 years old. She is very focused on her work. For her, education and attention to her children are priorities. But in her home, they are humble people where both the mother and father work in order to pay the bills.

Luz Estella has a sewing business in her home. She has a sewing machine where she offers her services as well as makes items to order. Today her sewing isn't generating much income so she seeks alternatives to earn more money that will enable her to improve her quality of life, which is reflected in how they eat, dress, their home, and their business. Her idea is to improve sales, attract customers, achieve sustainability, offer something new and she wants to start her own line of blouses and shirts that she will sell from her home. She will start wtih friends, neighbors, and clients, and thus try to generate greater income but her barrier is the high cost of the supplies.

Luz seeks a loan to buy fabric, the main supply needed to make her articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, the main supply needed to make her articles of clothing.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 48-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a butcher by profession. He sells chicken from his shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell them in his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop.

Therefore, Salma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her son can buy broilers to sell in his shop. She dreams of providing all facilities to her children.

loans.use: to help her son to purchase broilers to sell.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a 34-year-old farmer from Mayere Umbo village. She joined Babban Gona to improve the life of her children. Since joining Babban Gona, Rhoda no longer has to worry about having insufficient income to pay for her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Rhoda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the yield of the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With Babban Gona's support, Rhoda has the chance to increase her yields and increase her net income considerably. Despite her small landholding of 0.3 hectares, she has ambitious dreams for acquiring more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farm yields.

loans.name: Enira

texts.es: Son dos los negocios que tiene Enira: un restaurante y también comercializa ropa en general, estas actividades le  han ayudado dese hace 25 años, a sostener a su familia, pues como madre de dos hijos, hoy en las edades de 25 y 27 años y en condición de separada, debió generar ingresos autónomos para ese fin. Enira aprovechó su experiencia en restaurantes cuando trabajó y  esta expereincia la puso en práctica de manera autonoma para ganar dinero mediante su propio negocio. Desatunos, almuerzos, meriencias y senas son los productos que prepara en su negocio y vende de contado diariemente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, horario en el cual trabaj. Sus vecinos son sus principales clientes, parq ueien Enira se ha convertido en su alida que soluciona las necesidades de aliemnto a buen precio y de articulos que llos requieren como ropa y calzado. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local y continuar apoyando a sus hijos aunque su mayor desafio para generar maas utilidades sea el exceso de competencia y el incuficinete capital con el que cuenta para incrmentar sus productividad. En la actualidad está aplicando  un credikiva, primer finanicmeointo que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domngo, mediante el cual comprará un enfriador para mejorar la conservación de alimentos y materias primas que le permitirán aumentar la producción; con esta inversión planea el incremento de sus ventas para más adelante lograr sus objetivos de prosperidad gradualmente.
texts.en:
Enira has two businesses: selling clothing and a restaurant. She has had these businesses for 25 years and through them supports her family. She is the mother of two children ages 27 and 25. She is separated from her husband, so she had to generate her own income. Enira took advantage of her experience in restaurants when she worked and this experience enabled her to open her own business with the money she saved. Breakfasts, lunches, snacks, and dinners are the products that she prepares and sells daily from 6 AM until 6 PM. Her neighbors are her main customers, being the solution for them by selling food at a good price as well as clothing items that they need such as clothing and shoes.

Her goal in the future is to have her own locale and continue supporting her children even though her main goal is to generate more income even though there is a lot of competition and she needs additional capital to increase her production.

Today she seeks a loan from Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domngo, with which she will buy a cooler to better keep her food and also ingredients that will enable her to increase production. With this investment she plans to increase her sales to later achieve her objectives of gradually prospering.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and ingredients.

loans.name: Katy Vaneza

texts.es:
Katy una empresaria de 28 años de edad que desde hace 7 meses se desempeña como vendedora de ganado porcino, ella adopto esta profesión ante la oportunidad de crear empresa que le genero la corporación Interactuar, ella se encuentra muy feliz y motivada porque con su negocio ha visto como la calidad de vida comienza a aumentar, desde el capital para pagar las deudas, la alimentación, la educación, la vestimenta cosas triviales que hacen a Katy sentirse orgullo de lo que hace.

Ella es madre de dos hijos uno de 6 y la menor de 4, ellos son su motor de vida, su principal fuente de inspiración y gracias a ellos tomo el atrevimiento de crear empresa, solo por darles la mejor calidad de vida que estuviera a su alcance.

Katy solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de cerdos y adecuaciones de cocheras, comprara los siguientes materiales, zinc, concreto, tubos para crear canales de riegos, alambres y cercas.
texts.en:
Katy is a 28-year-old entrepreneur has worked for seven months as a seller of pigs. She took up the profession when she had the opportunity to create a business that the organization Interactuar helped her generate. 

She feels very happy and motivated because with her business she has seen how her quality of life has begun to improve – from money to pay off her debts, to food, to education, to clothing and to trivial things that make Katy feel proud of what she does.  

She is the mother of two children – one is six and the younger is four. They are the driving force in her life and her main source of inspiration. Thanks to them, she was daring enough to start her own business just to give them a better quality of life that was out of reach. 

Katy is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs and improvements to her sheds, as well as buy the following materials: zinc, concrete, tubes to create irrigation canals, wire and fencing.

loans.use: to buy pigs, make shed adjustments and buy materials including zinc, concrete, tubes to create irrigation canals, wire and fencing.

loans.name: Elvira Isabel

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer de 58 años de edad, una persona tierna, cariñosa y simpática, ella comparte su hogar con su esposo, con el cual tiene una hija de 15 años de edad que se encuentra cursando el penúltimo grado de la educación básica, ella siempre se ha caracterizado por preparar unos riquísimos pasteles y tamales, un amigo le sugirieron que vendiera, que esa habilidad podía ser explotada, a la señora Elvira le quedo sonando mucho la idea y hace un año inicio a ofertar sus productos.  Elvira se llevó una grata sorpresa los clientes quedaron fascinados con el sabor de sus comidas.

Su negocio le ha valido para pagar la educación de su hija, mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, comprar los artículos para el hogar que tanto quería y crearse una independencia económica.

Su meta en este momento es montar un restaurante, eso que paso hace un año lo quiere trasmitir y evolucionar, tiene que trabajar muy duro para juntar el capital necesario pero tiene la convicción de que lo lograra.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la elaboración de tamales y pasteles, quiere mejorar sus ventas, inventario y utilidad.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 58-year-old woman. She is a sweet, caring, and kind person. She shares her home with her husband, with whom she has a 15-year-old daughter. Her daughter is in her second to last year of high school. Elvira has always been known for preparing very delicious pastries and tamales. A friend suggested that she sell them, since that ability could be utilized. Elvira was left dreaming of the idea, and a year ago she started selling her products. Elvira was pleasantly surprised to see that her customers were fascinated with the flavor of her food.

Her business has helped her to pay for her daughter’s education, to improve her household’s conditions, to buy the household items that she wanted so much, and to form an economic independence for herself. Her goal at the moment is to establish a restaurant. She wants to transmit and evolve what happened a year ago. She has to work very hard to gather the necessary capital, but she is certain that she can do it.

She is requesting a loan to make tamales and pastries. She wants to improve her sales, inventory, and profit.

loans.use: to buy food to make tamales and pastries.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 58 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Rosario espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 58 years old, lives with his wife and his two children in the Cañaris district, a community dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock, which is located in the Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú. 

He makes a living growing coffee, and he has been doing this work for 10 years, which has given him experience in this sector and good personal and work references from his neighbors. He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee farm. With this Rosario hopes to offer better quality coffee to his clients, which will generate better revenue that will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee farm

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es:
la asociación comunal Venceremos está conformada por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres  y un hombre, padres y madres responsables de quince hijos, todos menores de edad, el cual están estudiando, son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la  actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Benita y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, tites, queso, hielos etc., ella dedica a sus negocio unas doce horas diarias, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que es el sostén de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Venceremos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Venceremos communal bank has eight members: seven women and one man. They are the responsible parents of a total of fifteen children, all young and in school. The group members are from Malpaisillo, located in the north of the region. They are hard-working, responsible, and have a great desire to succeed personally. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, they were unable to study and they needed to start working at a young age to help out with the household costs. They are currently working hard day to day to offer their children a better future.
Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Benita is the group coordinator. She has a small store where she sells small quantities of edible products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, cheese, ice cream, etc. She works twelve hours a day from her home. She works very hard and the business supports her family. She will invest this loan to stock her business to that she can have a greater income in the near future.
Venceremos is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce recourses and in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to stock the store with edible products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, cheese, and ice cream.

loans.name: El Proyecto Group

texts.es:
El proyecto está conformado por ocho mujeres, madres solteras, trabajadoras, responsable de quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, y se caracteriza por ser un lugar productor de leche, queso,  estas mujeres realizan diferentes actividades económicas, y luchan para salir adelante con sus negocios y brindarle un futuro mejor a sus familias, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar. El cual las obligo a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Francisca y tiene por actividad económica la venta Cerdos en pie,  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo su productos. El objetivo de crédito es invertir en el negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francisca agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of 8 women, all hardworking single mothers, responsible for 15 children under their care. They are from Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern part of the region which is known for being a producer of milk and cheese. These women work in different fields, and strive to get ahead with their businesses, and so be able to give their families a better future. Sadly, due to a lack of financial resources they were not able to get an education, which forced them to work from an early age.

Due to her drive to get ahead in life, Francisca is the coordinator of the group, and sells live pigs for a living. Her business is run from her own home. She devotes 8 hours every day to her business, offering her products.

The purpose of the loan money is to invest in her business of purchasing and selling live pigs, so that in the near future she will be able to get a better income. Francisca is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources in poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they are able to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase live pigs.

loans.name: Las Pilitas Group

texts.es:
LAS PILITAS  ESTÁN CONFORMADA POR OCHO MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PADRES DE FAMILIA CON DIES HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  REYNA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN LA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. Y CONSISTE EN VENDER CERDOS POR ENCARGO A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES,  SU JORNADA DE TRABAJO ES DE UNA OCHO HORAS DIARIAS, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA  CON MUCHO GUSTO.  EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES COMPRA UN LOTE DE CERDOS EN PIE PARA LA CRIANZA Y LA VENTA, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LAS PILITAS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Las Pilitas group consists of eight women and one man  from northern León, all parents, with ten children between them. The members were all  unable to pursue an education as children, and went to work very young so they could contribute earnings to their families. Consequently, the Las Pilitas members are all industrious, honest people eager to improve their lives.  

The group members made Reyna their coordinator for her drive and ambition. She sells live pigs for a living, keeping the herd next to her home, and selling to long-term and newer customers. Reyna spends eight hours a day caring for the herd, and does her work enthusiastically.
