Reyna is applying for a loan to purchase a batch of pigs that she'll raise and sell, and hopes to boost her income in the short term. All of the group members are grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with little wealth in poor countries like Nicaragua earn an honest living.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of live pigs.

loans.name: Ever Amadeo

texts.es:
Ever es un hombre de 36 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades de entre 3 y 15 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Ever es un padre de familia responsable que para mantener a su familia trabaja como mecánico automotriz, desde hace 1 año pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como albañil, gracias a estas dos actividades ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Ahora Ever ve la necesidad de construir su casa, pues su familia carece de ella, aunque una de las dificultades que Ever tiene es que a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos no ha logrado completar el dinero necesario, por tal razón solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para completar su capital y comprar cemento, arena, hierro y blocks.
El gran anhelo de Ever es seguir mejorando su casa para darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ever is a 36-year-old man who is married and has a lovely family of four children between the ages of 3 and 15 years. This humble family lives in a community in San Andres Semetabaj.

Ever is a responsible father who, in order to maintain his family, has worked as an automobile mechanic for the past year. At the same time, in order to be able to improve their income, he is also working as a cement mason. Thanks to these two activities, he has managed to advance his family.

Now, Ever sees the possibility of constructing their own house, since his family lacks one. But despite all his efforts, he has not been able to accumulate the necessary money. For that reason, he is requesting a loan, which will be utilized to accumulate the necessary capital and purchase cement, sand, construction iron and cement blocks for the task.

Ever's great hope is to continue improving the new house so that he can offer his family a better life.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, construction iron and cement blocks to build his own home.

loans.name: Philibus Yayo

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona to grow his agribusiness. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Philibus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the yield of the average smallholder maize farmer in Nigeria. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Philibus can now produce higher yields and increase his income, enabling him to send his children to good schools and ensure that they get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will  increase his yields

loans.name: Tulibamu Kyakamese Group

texts.en:
Jolly, whose hand is raised in the group photograph is a fifty-two-year-old widow with six children living in Masindi, Uganda. Her major business is agriculture and she works hard to get income from this business to look after her children. She hopes to educate her children and construct a permanent house.

Jolly is requesting a loan to help her with weeding, ploughing and buying chemicals.

loans.use: to pay for ploughing, weeding and buying chemicals.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a farmer living in Sarakap village of Shirak region. She is a mother of three. Karine's elder son serves in the army, and other two help their mother with farming. Karine also lives with her 90-year-old mother-in-law and her husband. They are all occupied with agriculture. 

Their farm includes livestock: four cows, calves, 120 sheep, two pigs and 60 hens. They also cultivate wheat and barley, selling part of the harvest in the market and using the other part as a forage for feeding the livestock. 

Karine and her family are now asking for financial support. Karine has applied for this loan to purchase pigs and be able to expand her farming business. Because the region where Karine's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high; people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses.

Karine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for three pigs needed for the expansion of the farm

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas and at the same time he distills waragi (a local alcoholic drink) in his area. He faces a challenge of lack of capital that hinders the progress of his business. However, he is working very hard to expand his banana plantation and have a healthy family. 

Medard has asked for a loan to hire a banana plantation to harvest and distill waragi to sell.

loans.use: to hire a banana plantation to harvest and distill waragi (local brew) to sell

loans.name: Kabata Kweterana Group

texts.en:
John is a member of Kabata Kweterana, a group where members guarantee each other, and is aged 34 with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a retail business and does farming that adds to his income. He faces challenges of price fluctuation that hinder the progress of his business. 

Besides that, he has future prospects of expanding his retail shop to new areas in order to earn more profits. John has asked for a loan to add stock of sugar, rice, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate used the previous loan to  buy soap, cooking oil, bread, sugar, and salt to sell. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, and has a retail business and at the same time does baking of bread that earns her more income. She faces a challenge of defaulters who makes her business come to a standstill. However, she has future hopes of building a permanent home.

 Immaculate needs a loan to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel es un hombre de 46 años de edad, el es un padre de 6 hijos de 19, 16, 11, 9, 2,  1 años de edad, vive junto con su esposa y su familia depende de los ingresos que Fidel genere.

Fidel se desempeña como independiente en la cría de ganado porcino, la importancia de su negocio es muy grande y no tiene margen de error porque 7 personas dependen de los recursos que genere.

La cría de cerdos ha sido muy buena alternativa, antes cuando trabaja y se ganaba un salario ordinario no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gatos, pero desde que desarrolla está actividad ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, sus hijos estudian, se alimentan bien y son felices.

Fidel quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ganado porcino + alimento, quiere abastecer sus cocheras y mejorar su negocio para no perder de vista un viejo sueño que se trazó y le prometió a su pareja, el cual es comprar una vivienda propia para dejarle de herencia un día a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fidel is a 46-year-old man. He is the father of six children, ages 19, 16, 11, 9, 2 and 1. He lives together with his wife, and his family depends on the income Fidel generates.

Fidel works independently raising swine. The business is of great importance and there is no margin for error because 7 people depend on the resources it generates.

Pig farming has been a very good alternative. Before, when he worked and earned an ordinary salary, it wasn't enough to cover all of his expenses. But, since he started this business he has been able to improve his family’s living conditions. His children study, they eat well, and they are happy.

Fidel wants to request a loan to purchase swine and feed. He wants to stock his pens and improve his business so as not to lose sight of an old dream that had been laid out and which he had promised to his spouse, which is to someday buy their own house to leave to their children.

loans.use: to purchase swine and feed to stock his pig pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a solar home solution for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is thirty-one years old and is a married woman with five children living in Masindi, Uganda.

Her major business is agriculture and from this she has managed to look after her family and educate her children. She is affected by seasonal factors but hopes to educate her children and also get involved in mechanized agriculture.

Fatuma intends to use the loan to help her in ploughing, weeding and buying pesticides.

loans.use: to help her in ploughing, weeding and buying pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of human hair pieces for sale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit and her two children live in Jrapi village in the Shirak region. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, so Anahit has to take care of their children and household alone.

Due to hard and tireless work, Anahit perfectly manages to run her family farm and also take care of her children. She keeps cows, calves and hens, and also cultivates wheat and some grass for the livestock.

She has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her farm. She needs to purchase five calves, barley seed and fertilizer for land cultivation. This will help her a lot. Because the region where Anahit's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses.

Anahit's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for five calves, barley seed and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 39 years old, a single woman, from the village of Zemo Chaladidi. She takes care of two school-aged children and earns a living on her own. The family lives under poverty, having no source of significant income. 

Maia has gradual work as a nurse in Turkey. She gets a really small income and is unable to meet even the basic needs of her family. She requires a stable source of income to provide financial stability and a monthly income. 

Maia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for trading business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

After several unsuccessful attempts her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income so do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Maia will start purchasing clothing at wholesale prices and will sell in her community with price mark-ups. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To develop a stable source of income and sell clothing

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is a married man and he has 3 children. He describes himself to be visionary.

Haron operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are the general public.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells radios, calculators, padlocks, and other items. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of radios, calculators, padlocks, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of radios, calculators, padlocks, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, onions, green beans, cucumbers, garlic, beans, pineapples, and guavas.

loans.name: Ahabyona

texts.en:
Ahabyona is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ahabyona has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Ahabyona has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water, and will help Ahabyona to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Ahabyona hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is married and has four children. She also takes care of additional family members. She is a tailor. She has been in this business for over 30 years.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy rolls of clothing material.

She works in a shop six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of rolls of raw material. She would like to buy an electric sewing machine and also build rental rooms. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy rolls of clothing material.

loans.name: Sofaira

texts.es:
Sofaira es una mujer determinante con fortaleza, carácter, arriesgada, audaz, ella es separada de su esposo, quedo como madre cabeza de familia que ahora son adolescente y que le agradecen mucho a la vida por la mujer que tienen de madre, verla trabajar en una profesión como la carpintería que a lo largo del tiempo ha sido un empleo donde los hombres han predominado es de verdad de admirar.

Ella aprendió la profesión de un amigo, le gusto el cuento de la carpintería, es muy creativa para sacar muebles y muy efectiva para repararlos.

Tiene un taller ubicado en su hogar, en este ofrece empleo temporal a sus hijos, gracias a este negocio paga las deudas puesto que es su única fuente de ingreso.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en su totalidad en madera, con la madera realiza algunos muebles que espera vender muy bien, mejorara sus ventas, aumentara sus clientes, ganara reconocimiento y todo ello para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Sofaira is a determined woman with great strength, character, courage, and fearlessness. She is separated from her husband; therefore, as a mother, she is the head of her household. Her children are now teenagers, and they are very thankful for the woman who is their mother. Seeing her work in a profession like carpentry, which throughout time has been a job that men have dominated, is truly admirable.

She learned this work from a friend. She enjoys carpentry, and she is very creative, building furniture and repairing it very effectively. She has a workshop, which is located in her home. There, she offers temporary work to her children. Thanks to this business, she is able to pay her debts. This work is her only source of income.

She is requesting a loan, which she will use in its entirety to buy wood. With this wood, she will build some pieces of furniture that she hopes to sell very well. She will also improve her sales, expand her customer base, and gain recognition in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood in order to build furniture such as chairs and cabinets, among other furniture pieces.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children and none of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop.

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water and will help Margret to generate greater profits and increase capital. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire more capital.

loans.use: to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en:
Zaverio is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Zaverio has been working hard to manage his business, which sells produce.

To help expand his business, Zaverio has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Zaverio to generate greater profits and expand his business.

Zaverio hopes that in the future, he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his produce business.  

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of produce and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and increase income. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of produce.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which operates a beer depot. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy stock of beer and will help Stella to generate greater profits and increase income. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to increase capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of beer.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his business, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy groundnuts, simsim, and rice, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, simsim, and rice.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, rice, flour, beans, peas, cooking oil and salt. She has been in this retail business for almost ten years. She generates additional income from selling piped water and charcoal. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice, flour, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a massage table, towels, and chairs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is widowed with six children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She sells used clothes and has been in this business for 12 years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She works five days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to get a permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is from Ayntap village where she lives with her husband and his family. She studies at university and specializes in the pedagogical department. Lusine studies hard and dreams of becoming a teacher and finding a job. She asks lenders to support her educational loan. Lusine hopes to receive lenders' support and continue her studies at the university.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim, who is a 38 year-old married man, lives in the village of Kirovka with his wife and 2 school-aged children. The family gets income from a small agricultural activity. They have a small amount of land, where they harvest fruits and sell them seasonally. Rasim also works as an artisan and gets an insignificant income. The family members live in poverty and have no source of significant income to tackle their financial difficulties. Rasim requires financial support to start his own activity and somehow improve the family's living condition.
 
According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Rasim requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing  business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are considered “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Rasim plans to purchase a hand tractor and also a mowing-machine and start working on private orders.
 
This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Rasim will satisfy his family's increased needs and make a better style of life for his family members.

loans.use: to purhcase a hand tractor and a mowing-machine.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Shufa, who is in her mid 20s, is single with three children who are still at school. She has been running a hardware shop for seven years now. She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Shufa's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the hardware stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast selling hardware and to restock items in her shop. She dreams of building her house and to extend her business.

Shufa, will share this loan with her loan group Ulezi which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware and to restock items in her shop.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zamu is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She has a business selling charcoal and green bananas. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

She works from home six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy more land to supplement her income. The family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and charcoal.

loans.name: Kwanze Kwanze

texts.en:
Kwanze Kwanze is 60 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Kwanze Kwanze has been working hard to manage her bar. 

To help expand her business, Kwanze Kwanze has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wine, and will help Kwanze Kwanze to generate greater profits and improve on stock in the bar. Kwanze Kwanze hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of wine for her bar

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She has a business of selling charcoal and has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for 4 years. She generates additional income selling piped water. She works from home seven days week on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to build rental houses to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Owen has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Owen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy Vim, oils, and soft drinks, and will help Owen to generate greater profits and improve the shop. Owen hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy Vim, oils, and soft drinks

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom attend school. She supports two additional family members. Joyce operates a beauty salon and has been in business for the last eight years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair treatments, oils, shampoo, rollers, and relaxers. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to buy salon seats and a hand dryer to improve her services. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair treatments, oils, shampoo, and rollers.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusufu is a hard-working man from Nyakatunda cell, Isingiro district. He has applied for 2,000,000 UGX to add manure in his banana plantation which has fed his family for ten years. He has a wife who is a hardworking woman who mobilizes income from her goats.

However, his plantation is not up-to-date because he fetches little income but has a dream to get more bananas from this plantation. Therefore, Yusufu approached UGAFODE for money to buy more cow dung, grass, and hire labour for his plantation. He is hard-working and appreciates UGAFODE's support.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hardworking lady from Kakyenkye, Mbarara district. She grew up with her parents who educated her to the end and now she has a secretarial business in Mbarara town. But now she has limited capital to expand and has requested money to buy more computers so that she can begin internet services. This will help to increase her income. She will use proceeds from the business to repay the loan. She is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 4, 9, 12, 15 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de chinelas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labora la realiza en ‘El Torno’ que se encuentra a 32 kilómetros al Sudoeste de la ciudad, se caracteriza por Su pintoresco paisaje cubierto por vegetación tropical.  Posee una importante riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre. Es centro de acopio de productos del campo. Con una temperatura media anual de 24 grados centígrados.
Claudia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, estatura alta, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (fila de atrás la segunda de la izquierda, lleva unas gafas de sol sobre la cabeza). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba extractora. Sus ganas de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y poder continuar con su trabajo. Ella se dedica al comercio de chinelas, que es un tipo de sandalia hecha de una suela que se sostiene al pie por medio de una tira o cordón que separa el dedo gordo de los dedos restantes. Su rutina diaria inicia muy temprano por la mañana ordenando sus productos en su puesto fijo de venta para exhibir toda su mercadería, pasada la tarde recoge su sombrilla y todas sus prendas para guardarlas hasta el día siguiente, “Las chinelas son un calzado muy accesible porque sirven muy bien para el clima cálido de aquí y su precio es bastante razonable…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el clima del lugar crea la necesidad de un calzado fresco y sus clientes son continuos, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de chinelas por mayor para surtir su negocio y abrir otro puesto de venta. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de chinelas por mayor para surtir su negocio y abrir otro puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 31 year old woman who lives with her partner. They have 4 children ages 4, 9, 12, and 15.  Her business involves selling flip flops.  She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, optimistic, patient, responsible, and a very hard worker.  Her work is done in a place called "El Torno" which is loacted 32 kilometers southeast of the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia.  The town is known for its picturesque landscape which is covered in tropical vegetations.  It possesses important forest riches and diverse wild animals.  It is a center for purchasing supplies for the rural area.  It has an annual median temperature of 24 degrees centigrade.   

Claudia has brown skin, brown eyes, is of medium height, and has long black hair that she wears up.  She is of medium stature and her maternal language is Guaraní.  She speaks Guaraní at home and Spanish with the wider population and for work.  (In the photograph she is in the second row, the second from the left, wearing sunglasses on her head).  

She share her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her children, who study in school.  The youngest has not yet started school.  They live in their own room built out of brick and cement with a corrugated iron ceiling. They have electricity and water from a well extracted via a pump.  

Her desire to get ahead brought her to lead this communal banking group in order to request a loan and be able to continue with her work.  She works selling flip flops, which is a type of sandal made with a sole that stays on your foot through the help of a thong or cord that separates the big toe from the little toes.  Her daily routine begins very early in the morning when she organizes her products in her fixed stall in order to exhibit all of her merchandise.  At the end of the afternoons she collects her umbrella and all of her product to store them until the next day.  "The flip flops are a very accessible form of footwear because they work well for the warm climate here and the price is rather reasonable," She comments.  The benefit of her business is that the climate in her area creates the need for fresh footwear and her customers are regulars.  The disadvantage is the competition.  Her dream is that her children can become professionals.  

She wants to expand her business through the purchase of flip flops in bulk in order to stock her business and open another stall for sales.  This is the third sequence of loans that her group has requested in the two years that she has been working in this business.  For these reasons Claudia is asking for a loan in order to purchase flip flops in bulk to supply her business and open another stall.

loans.use: to expand her business through the purchase of flip flops in bulk in order to stock her business and open another stall for sales.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 21 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, que por la falta de recursos económicos solo estudio hasta noveno grado, se acompañó pero su relación no funciono y es padre de una niña. 

Javier, humildemente se dedica a la venta de pan de manera ambulante, esta actividad la realiza aproximadamente desde hace 2 años y fue por medio de un amigo que él aprendió esta actividad; antes solo se dedicaba a la agricultura.- Actualmente, sale a comercializar el pan en su motocicleta, cubre la mayoría de cantones de dicho municipio, recorre alrededor de 10 a 6 kilómetros diarios.

Javier, solicita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta, ya que con la que cuenta actualmente es la del dueño del negocio.

Su mayor sueño, es tener su propia panadería, así como también sueña con darle lo mejor a su hija y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Javier is 21 years old, he is a real battler, who only studied until the ninth grade due to a lack of economic resources. He was in a relationship but it did not work out, and he is the father of a girl.

He humbly earns a living selling bread as a mobile vendor. He has been doing this for about two years and it was through a friend that he learnt this business. Before this he worked only in agriculture. Now he goes out selling bread on his motorbike, he covers the majority of cantons of his municipality, travelling around 10 to 6 kilometres a day.

Javier is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike, since the one he currently uses belongs to the owner of the business.

His greatest dream is to have his own bakery, and he also dreams of giving his daughter the best, and enlarging his house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es: Maria Irene se levanta todas las mañanas para crear los riquísimos pasteles que le encantan a sus clientes. Su esposo y sus hijos son su principal apoyo en este negocio que poco a poco ha venido aumentando su producción, para no parar la producción de los riquísimos pasteles Maria Irene solicita un crédito para comprar Huevo, Azúcar, Leche, Harina entre otros materia prima necesaria para la realización de los pasteles. De esta manera podrá surtir la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria Irene gets up every morning to create the delicious cakes that her customers love. Her husband and her children are her main support in this business. Bit by bit she has increased her output, in order to not halt the production of the delicious cakes Maria Irene is asking for a loan to buy eggs, sugar, milk and flour among other raw ingredients needed for the making of the cakes. In this way she can supply her customers demand and obtain a greater income.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, milk and flour among other ingredients.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Erika de 38 años de edad, es soltera con 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Tiene el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “EL PROGRESO” conformada por 6 mujeres responsables y con alma de emprendedoras. Erika tiene como fuente de trabajo la confección de zapatillas en su taller que implemento en su propia casa, es por ello que el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá para comprar más materiales que necesita para producir más zapatillas que sus clientes le solicitan, así de esta manera Erika con el esfuerzo que le pone en su negocio trata de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos. Uno de los anhelos que tiene Erika es poder obtener un puesto donde pueda vender todo tipo de calzado que ella misma confecciona. En la foto del grupo Erika se encuentra de pie junto a las demás señoras sentadas.
texts.en: Erika is 38 years old, she is single with two dependant children. She has the role of president of the communal bank EL PROGRESO made up of six responsible women with an entrepreneurial spirit. Erika works making slippers in her workshop that she set up in her own home, and this is why she will invest the loan requested in buying more materials that she needs to produce more slippers that her customers ask for. In this way, with the effort that she puts into her business, Erika can try to offer a better quality of life to her small children. One of her wishes is that she can get a stall where she can sell all types of shoes that she makes herself. In the group photo Erika is standing next to the other women who are seated.

loans.use: to buy materials for her workshop.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is Fatu, 36. She is married and has one child who is six years old. Fatu has a degree in BSC Education and is a teacher by profession.   

In 2002, Fatu established her grocery business. She started it because her salary as a teacher was not enough to support her family. She works six days a week, 11 hours per day. She has one sales assistant who takes care of the shop while she is at work.

Fatu has received and paid one loan in full and on time. She now requires a loan of 6,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leons (SLL) to buy more groceries to sell, including powdered milk, sardines, mayonnaise and pure water. She hopes this second loan will help her increase her profit to 900,000 SLL. 

In the future, Fatu plans to open a water manufacturing factory. She thanks Kiva for its support

loans.use: to improve her business by buying more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo lives alone at his house, which is located in the Pampa Belen community. He sells milk to earn money. Maximo has been on a farm since he was a kid and he works for an industrial milk plant. He also is a mason and provides his services to his community.

Maximo needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He would like to have a sewerage system at his house in the future. Maximo is single and he doesn't have kids, but he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mobile accessories and touch lights for resale.

loans.name: Brookes Jaile

texts.en:
Brookes Jaile is married and has one child. She is 22 years old and lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about six years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers.

She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 3,600 per month.

Brookes Jaile is seeking a PHP 13,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. In her previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Brookes Jaile is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy new sets for her foot spa services.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Joseph.  He is married and has two children, ages 8 and 6.  In 2001, Joseph established his patent medicine business. He began this business because he needed to create employment for himself and to provide a livelihood for his family. Joseph works six days and 11 hours a day.   He earns about SSL 1,200,000 every month from his business. 

Joseph would like a loan in the amount of SSL 5,000,000 to purchase more cartons of different types of drugs for resale. He believes that this loan will help him increase his monthly profit in the future. Joseph still plans to establish a medicine business in his hometown.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Los Agricultores De Panimache Quinto Group

texts.es:
Mariano es un joven de 21 años de edad, es soltero tiene un hijo de un año, esta linda familia vive en Chichicastenango.
Mariano (es el que se encuentra en medio de la fotografía de playera gris) con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, trabaja como jornalero desde hace 15 años, pues el comenzó esta labor desde muy pequeño.
Mariano ahora se ve a la necesidad de construir su pequeña cocina porque la que ahora tiene está a punto de derrumbarse, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario, por tal razón está solicitando un crédito junto a un grupo de personas para comprar, arena, blocks, laminas.
Mariano sueña con poder  construir su cocina este año, y conseguir un trabajo fijo para construir otro cuarto.
texts.en: Mariano is a 21 year old young man, single, with a 1 year old son. This beautiful family lives in Chichicastenango. Mariano (he is in the middle of the photograph wearing the grey shirt) has the goal to generate income and support his family. He has been working as a laborer for 15 years, starting at a very young age. Mariano now sees the need to build a small kitchen because the one he has now is at the point of crumbling. But one of the difficulties he has is that he doesn't have the money, so he is seeking a loan with a group of people to buy sand, blocks, and steel laminate. Mariano dreams of being able to build his kitchen this year, and get a steady job in order to build another room.

loans.use: to buy sand, blocks, and steel laminate.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 55, is married with three children. She lives in Mabuhay, Rizal, in the Philippines. A farmer, Rebecca grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

Rebecca has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and compost. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for two years. 

In the future, she hopes to harvest more vegetables to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie, 28, is married and lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is good at doing her farming activities and has had this business for three years. 

Josie requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Josie hopes to engage in a new business to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce

loans.name: Elanie

texts.en:
Elanie is married with two children, and the family lives in Calube, Aloran, Philippines. She is a diligent and determined mother who never stops pursuing her dreams for the benefit of her family. Elanie earns a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops and cafes. 

Elanie decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 7,608.38  PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her husband, Elanie smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has always dreamed of opening and managing her own retail store to support her needs. She is married and lives in Motibot, Sindangan, in the Philippines. 

Lucia applied for a loan to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk, and canned goods. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and supporting her needs.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 62 years old and a resident of SWP, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two children. She owns a rice retailing business that forms part of their house, and her neighbors are their clients.

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve their small business to support their children. So, she has requested a loan at Paglaum MPC in the amount of 20,000 PHP.

Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy additional rice in bulk.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a farmer from Sipaon, Rizal who plants a variety of flowers to sell. She is requesting a loan to pay for fertilizer and compost.

Perla hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Yamina

texts.en: Yamina has a piece of agricultural land in South Mapang, Rizal. She grows rice and corn and earns well for her family. She is thankful that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative has been her constant financing partner for her farming activities. Now she has applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Yamina hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is from Oroquieta. She is earning a living in her small grocery store business, supporting her husband, who provides income for their family.

To generate more income, Esterlita decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales.

Esterlita smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales.

loans.name: Gonzalo Eudaldo

texts.es:
Portoviejo  la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive señor Gonzalo, tiene 56  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
Don Gonzalo es jardinero y comerciante de plantas de interiores y exteriores (césped, palmas de todo tipo, flores, rosas, etc.) a más de dar mantenimiento de jardines en casas particulares y canchas de fútbol, este negocio lo tiene por más de 40 años, él trabaja de lunes a sábados todo el día, inicio su negocio con capital propio, tiene un  espacio  en su casa en el cual tiene sus plantas, maquinarias y equipos para hacer mantenimiento. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo y un sobrino. Las personas amantes de las plantas lo prefieren porque tiene las mejores plantas y da el mejor mantenimiento en cuanto a jardines.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar variedad de plantas (rosas, césped, flores, etc.). Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos años y le gusta el crédito  por que es rápido y sin tantos documentos.  Su sueño es  que el negocio crezca y sea el mejor de la zona.
texts.en:
Portoviejo the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador, is known as the oldest settled city on the Ecuadorean Coastal region. It is gaining ground in the tourism field as this canton has beaches, city and countryside.

Gonzalo lives in this place. He is 56 years old, married and from this relationship has 3 children aged 18, 17 and 14 years old who study in Secondary school. His wife is a housewife.

Gonzalo is a gardener and vendor of interior and outside plants (grass, all kinds of palm trees, flowers, roses, etc) besides maintaining gardens at private residences and football fields. He has had this business for more than 40 years. He works every day from Monday to Saturday. He began the business with his own capital. He has a space at his house where he keeps his plants, machinery and equipment to do his maintenance work. He works with the help of his son and a nephew. The people who love plants prefer him as he has better plants and provides the best maintenance for gardens.

He will use this loan to buy a variety of plants (roses, grass, flowers, etc.) He has been a member of the communal bank for two years and he likes it as it is quick without so many documents. His dream is for his business to grow and be the best in the zone.

loans.use: to buy plants.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a hardworking farmer who lives with his family on shared land called Villa Nueva, which has only 380 residents. Villa Nueva is located in the municipality of Misantla, in Veracruz, Mexico.  

Tomas harvests corn, beans, chili peppers and coffee. He and his family live on the income he gains from harvesting and selling his products. 

Nowadays, they light their home with a solar system, which is old and doesn't work well anymore. Tomas wants to buy new pieces, such as a battery, needed for the solar system to function properly. 

When the solar system works perfectly again, he and his family will improve their lifestyle by having light after sunset. As well, Tomas will be able to dekernel ears of corn at night.

loans.use: to repair his solar system so he and his family have light at night and improve their living conditions.

loans.name: María Filerma

texts.es:
Portoviejo  la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Filerma, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos mayores de edad e independientes.  Su esposo es agricultor. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Filerma tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad de  en la que vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  07h00 hasta las 20h00, ella se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos, tienen este negocio 4 meses y a pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  frutas y verduras. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 7 años  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y sea el mejor.
texts.en:
Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabí en Ecuador, known for being the oldest settled Ecuadorian city on the coastal region, is gaining ground in tourism since this county has a beach, city, and countryside.  

In this place lives Señora Filerma.  She is 55 years old, is married, and from this relationship has three adult and independent children.  Her husband is a farmer.  They live in their own house.

Doña Flerma has a stall in the city market from which she sells fruits and vegetables.  She works every day from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm.  She goes at sunrise to the wholesale market to buy better products to be able to offer them to her customers.  She works in company with her husband and her childrend.  They have had this business for four months, and even though is job is sacrificing, she has to do it for the well being of her family.

She is going to use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  She has been in the Grupo de Crédito for 7 years and likes it because it is a very united group.  She dream is that her business grows and becomes the best.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is known in his neighborhood area as a hardworking father. He is engaged in farming activities as a primary source of income to provide for his family. He became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

Rogelio hopes to live comfortably with a decent house. He has applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair his house for safe and comfortable living. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record. He has been given a priority as a regular member of PMPC. He is thankful that all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair his house for safe and comfortable living

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Fátima Narciza

texts.es:
Portoviejo  la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima,  tiene 58  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  3   hijos, dos mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo está encargado de la venta de comida en un bar de una escuela. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Fátima  es conserje de una escuela y también se dedica a la preparación y venta de bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadillas,  corviches, panes de almidón, maduros con queso entre otros. Su esposo es quien la ayuda en el bar de la escuela donde ella trabaja, ella vende bien y que le gusta esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar un horno, maní, almidón, plátano y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.  Tiene en el grupo de crédito 7 años y le gusta la responsabilidad de las socias y los créditos que son rápidos. Su sueño es tener otro bar más grande.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí province in Equador. Known for being the oldest Equadorian city situated in the coastal region, it is gaining in popularity with tourists as this canton has beaches, the city and countryside.

This is where Fátima lives, she is 58 years old, is married and from this relationship has three children, two adult and independent and one of 15 years of age who is studying in school. Her husband is in charge of selling food in the snack bar of a school. They live in their own home.

Fátima is the caretaker of a school and she also works preparing and selling sandwiches and fast food like empanadas, corviches (a dish made from green bananas and fish), panes de almidón (a type of bun with cheese) and plaintain with cheese among other things. Her husband helps her in the snack bar of the school where she works, she sells well and enjoys this work.

She is going to use this loan to buy an oven, peanuts, starch, bananas and other supplies for her food preparation. She has been in the credit group for seven years and she likes the responsibility of the members and that the loans are fast. Her dream is to have another, larger snack bar.

loans.use: to buy an oven, peanuts, starch, bananas and other supplies.

loans.name: Estefani Gabriela

texts.es:
Portoviejo  la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Estefani,  tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos  que estudian en la escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Estefani tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes.Trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 12h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, por lo general es ella pasa en su negocio, fue su abuelita la que le heredo la tienda  y es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene cinco años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 4 años y le gusta la unidad del grupo y  de la fundación que los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener un mini Market.
texts.en:
Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabí en Ecuador, known for being the oldest settled Ecuadorian city on the coastal region, is gaining ground in tourism since this county has a beach, city, and countryside. 

In this place lives Señora Estefani.  She is 22 years old, and she is a single mother of two children who study in school.  She lives in her parents' house.

Doña Estefani has a convenience store in her house.  There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.  She works every day from 7:00 am until 12:00pm and sometimes until later.  Generally, she is the one who works the business.  She inherited the store from her grandma, and it is there that she likes to be.  In addition to making a living, she entertain and informs herself of what is happening around her.  She has been working this job for five years, and it is going very well.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, meats, and other staples.  She has been in the Grupo De Créditos for four years, and she likes the unity of the group and of the foundation and that the interests are low.  Her dream is to have a mini Market.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, meats, and other staples.

loans.name: Juliano

texts.en:
Juliano is from Tudela. He has had a hog raising business for ten years. Recently, Juliano availed himself of a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

Juliano deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Bella Monserrate

texts.es:
Portoviejo  la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Bella, tiene 64 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es comerciante de frutas y verduras.
Doña Bella es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar y para esto ella realiza los créditos, para que él  utilice el crédito e invierta en su trabajo, él tiene  un puesto de venta de frutas y legumbres (pepinos, pimientos, piñas, sandias y frutas de temporada), ellos  salen a las 05h00 y regresan 16h00 todos los días, el puesto lo tiene en el mercado y ella y un hijo le ayudan en la venta todos los días. También algunas veces ellos entregan al menudeo por la zona.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  frutas y verduras. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la unidad del grupo y la rapidez de los créditos. Su sueño esque su negocio crezca y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabí en Ecuador, known for being the oldest settled Ecuadorian city on the coastal region, is gaining ground in tourism since this county has a beach, city, and countryside. 

In this place lives Señora Bella.  She is 64 years old, and has a common-law relationship from which she has five adult and independent children.  The spouse is a fruit and vegetable merchant.

Doña Bella is a good wife who wants to help her husband with the heavy burden of home; and, therefore, she is requesting the loans so that he can use the loan to invest in his work.  He has a fruit and vegetable stall (cucumbers, peppers, pineapples, watermelons, and seasonal fruits).  They leave at 5:00am and return at 4:00pm everyday.  He has the stall in the market, and she and a son help him to sell everyday.   Also, sometimes they deliver in the area. 

She is going to use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  She has been with Grupo De Crédito for two years, and she likes it for the unity of the group and quickness of the loans.  She dream is that her business grows and continues moving forward.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia, age 58, is married with five children.  Her husband works as a contractual laborer in construction but earns just enough for their hand-to-mouth needs. Cecilia was striving hard to earn a living without a stable job. The education of her five children and the day-to-day consumption was challenging, so she decided to open a store selling basic commodities.  

They were thankful that they joined Paglaum MPC. With very little capital, they were able to start their sari-sari (general store) business. Their daily sales go the extra mile for the family's needs. They were also able to save with their extra income. They have applied to Paglaum MPC for additional capital of PHP 10,000. They say they were attracted to Paglaum MPC for its savings and insurance services. They want to gradually expand their little store and taste a good life someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans et mariée, Joséphine est une femme qui vit à Adakpamé. Mère de deux enfants, Joséphine fait des savons préparés à l’aide de l’huile pour vendre. Joséphine est très dynamique et arrive à trouver son bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Joséphine s’approvisionne trois fois par mois. Pour commander des bidons d’huile, Joséphine demande ce microcrédit pour réaliser ses achats et réaliser plus de bénéfice pour permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Joséphine is a 29 year old married woman who lives in Adakpamé. Mother of two children, Joséphine makes soaps prepared with oil to sell. Joséphine is very dynamic and is reaching a profit through this activity. Joséphine resupplies three times per month. Joséphine is requesting this microloan to order some containers of oil and to achieve a greater profit, allowing for a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 4 containers of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install a sink in the kitchen, its water taps, and tubes to take the dirty water to the street gutter.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her bar.  

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, wine and soft drinks, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Juliet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more beer, wine and soft drinks

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a single mother and has 1 child. She is 52 years old and lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She has been in this business for about 5 years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 2,700 per month. Nida is seeking a PHP 14,900 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. Nida is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy new items for her foot spa business

loans.name: 020503010004 Phong Mỹ-Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
Hằng works in agriculture raising livestock and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Hằng is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 47 years old and she is married with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hằng is the group leader of the 020503010004 Phong Mỹ-Hoằng Phong solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2009, she joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. In the future, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation internationally.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 032006010002.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Nhàn works in agriculture raising poultry and has been involved in this business for three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. The main hardship that Nhàn faces in her business is the lack of capital. Nhàn is 29 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhàn is the group leader of the 032006010002.Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Nhàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Nhàn hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn 1 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Phúc has a manufacturing business sewing clothes and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase more cloth and equipment to make clothes to sell. The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business is the lack of capital. Phúc is 39 years old and she is married with two  children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Phúc is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 Thôn 1 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2014, Phúc joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. In the future, Phúc hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and equipment to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally, 45, is a mother of five children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice has been the source of her family’s income for more than ten years. 

Now, Phally is applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her farm. She hopes to earn more money and to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ruon's Group

texts.en:
Ruon, 52, is a mother of four children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice and construction work have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. 

Now, Ruon is applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her farm. She hopes to earn more money and to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Saiaiga

texts.en:
Saiaiga is a 32-year-old mother of 2 children. She runs a business providing grass cutting services to her customers. 

Saiaiga has requested a loan to buy a lawn mower, celluloid visor, safety uniform, safety boots, and chemicals to help run her business and maintain her high level of service. 

Saiaiga will use her profits to expand her business in the near future. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower, celluloid visor, safety uniform, safety boots, and chemicals.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 66 years old, married and a resident of Landing, Baliangao, Philippines.  Her husband is a manual laborer. They are blessed with 3 children. Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of 8,000 PHP. Their primary customers are their neighbors. She was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, of which she became a member in April 2006. She was able to avail herself of three loans and repaid them religiously. Now, she applies for a loan of 20,000 PHP to finance the additional stocks of basic commodities for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of basic commodities

loans.name: Swaibu

texts.en: Swaibu is a hardworking man, 35 years old, and a resident of Kabwohe and Sheema with four children and one dependent who he picked in Kabwohe town.  All his children and this dependent are in Kabwohe town schools and this gentleman has been in business for five years selling agricultural produce of beans, maize and coffee. He supplies schools in Bushenyi and Sheema and other people in Kabwohe town. This is a serious person who has been with UGAFODE for quite some time and is responsible for his family. Because of such family responsibilities, he wants UGX 2,500,000 to buy more stock, especially beans and coffee, to increase his stock and income.

loans.use: To buy coffee and beans

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se is a 52-year-old widowed mother of 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Se needs a loan in order to buy a new display fridge, chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. 

Se hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana is a Samoan citizen who is 50 years old with five children. 

Moana runs a business selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She has had this experience for more than a year. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to seek finances for her business. Moana hopes to gain more profit, but in order to do this, Moana requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a chainsaw, knife and shovel to help run the business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chainsaw, knife, and shovel

loans.name: Naren's Group

texts.en: Naren, age 52, is the mother of one child and lives in Kampong Cham province. Growing smoking tobacco and sesame are the sources of her family’s income for more than ten years. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Adera

texts.en:
Adera is 50 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with none of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Adera has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Adera has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to sell soft drinks, and will help Adera to generate greater profits and improve her business. Adera hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks

loans.name: Samir Felipe

texts.es:
La historia de Samir nos relata un cuento de un hombre de 30 años de edad que trabaja 14 horas todos los días de la semana en un negocio de calzado, el los confecciona y los vende, trabaja esta extensa jornada laboral porque empezó el negocio hace poco y como se comprometió a entregar pedidos en tiempos records, solo le queda sacrificarse mientras encuentra un equilibrio y tenga el capital para contratar a una persona.

Samir aprendió de la profesión gracias a que trabajo en la empresa de un buen amigo haciendo la misma labor, pero ganado un salario básico, que no le alcanzaba para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar, pero aguanto como pudo pro un tiempo hasta tener la suficiente experiencia y seguridad de lanzarse al mundo del trabajo independiente.

Sus principales dificultades para su negocio son dos, la fuerte competencia que hay, la inseguridad en el sitio del trabajo y los altos costos de insumos que para una persona humilde como él, que tiene toda la predisposición para trabajar es un impedimento muy fuerte.

Samir quiere solicitar un préstamo para la confeccionar calzado de línea propia, para vender en una vitrina que tiene, por ello necesita comprar suelas, cuero, plantillas.
texts.en:
The story of Samir tells us of a 30 year old man who works 14 hours everyday of the week in a footwear business.  He makes them and sells them.  He works these extensive workdays because he began the business recently, and since he promised to deliver orders in record time, he can only sacrifice while he finds a balance between having money to hire another person.

Samir learned this trade since he worked in a business of a good friend doing the same thing.  But he earned a base salary that was not covering the cost of the home.  But he put up with it as he could for a time until he had enough experience and confidence to launch himself into the world of self-employment.

His primary difficulties for the business are three: the strong competition, the insecurity of the work site, and the high costs of input for a humble person like himself; for someone who has all the willingness to work, this is a strong deterrent.

Samir wants to request a loan to manufacture is own footwear line, to sell in a storefront that he has; therefore, he needs to buy soles, leather, and insoles.

loans.use: To buy soles, leather, and insoles to manufacture his own footwear line to sell in a storefront that he has.

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en:
Iuni is 33 years old, and she is unmarried with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas which she sells in either her community or at the market. She has been doing this for a year now. 

Iuni requires a loan in order to buy gloves, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer, and boots. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2015. 

Iuni will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy gloves, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer, and boots

loans.name: Fagaofitu

texts.en:
Fagaofitu is a 38-year-old mother of 4 children. She operates a small business providing personal transportation services to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Fagaofitu has requested a loan in order to buy seat covers, paint, new windows, new wheels, and shocks to help her maintain the good service she provides. 

Fagaofitu hopes to use her profits to both buy another taxi and provide for family's needs. She joined South Pacific Business Development in 2011.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, paint, new windows, new wheels, and shocks.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is a 29-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Nila needs a loan to buy a new stove, bags of flour, baking soda, cooking oil, and baking trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Nila has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new stove, bags of flour, baking soda, cooking oil, and baking trays

loans.name: Grupo Agrícola Tzamjuyup Sector 1 Group

texts.es:
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa blanca) es una mujer de 56 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 12 y 35 años, pero cuatro de ellos se encuentran ya casados.
Para Catarina no hay nada más importante que su familia es por ello que para obtener sus ingresos se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 20 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica al cultivo de banano y maíz.
Catarina desde hace algún tiempo había sembrado unas parcelas de café que en estos días ya necesita de su mantenimiento, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder comprar sus fertilizantes, y pago de mano de obra, pero ella ha organizado a un grupo de personas con las mismas necesidades para juntas solicitar un préstamo y cubrir la necesidad que tiene.
Catarina sueña con poder construir su casa propia, y tener un negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
