Catarina (the first on the left side of the photo in a white shirt) is a 56 year old woman.  She is married and has a beautiful family of five children, ages 12 to 35, but four of them are already married.

For Catarina there is nothing more important than her family.  This is why she gets her income by dedicating herself to growing coffee, which she has done for 20 years.  But to improve her income she also grows bananas and corn.

Some time ago Catarina planted several plots of coffee that these days already need maintenance, but one of her difficulties is that she does not have the capital necessary to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.  However, she has organized a group of people with the same needs in order to request a loan together and cover the need she has.

Catarina dreams of being able to build her own home and to have a business of buying and selling groceries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ulaelemamae

texts.en:
Ulaelemamae is a 21-year-old unmarried mother of 2 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Ulaelemamae requires a loan in order to buy soya sauce, sacks of onions, bags of rice, snacks, soft drinks, and frozen goods. 

Ulaelemamae plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2012.

loans.use: to buy soya sauce, sacks of onions, bags of rice, snacks, soft drinks, and frozen goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 66-year-old mother with three children. She runs a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Mary requested a loan to buy a freezer, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than four years. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
A loan amount of 1,500 WST will help Julie to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, container, and a printing machine to help her run her business. 

Julie is 38 years old with four children. She runs a business of selling elei printing at the market to earn a living. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, container, and a printing machine,

loans.name: Laulaau

texts.en: Laulaau is a 21-year-old unmarried woman with no children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Laulaau needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, and a new stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Laulaau has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, and a new stove

loans.name: Suitiiti

texts.en:
Suitiiti is a 27-year-old, mother with three children. She runs a small business of cooking rice and fried chicken and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Suitiiti has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastics bags, and a container, to help her run the business. She will use her profits to build a small restaurant in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastics bags, and a container.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a Samoan citizen. She is 47 years old with seven children. She operates a business of selling taro and banana at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Ruta requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, taro root seedlings, banana root seedlings, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, and chemicals to help her run the business. Ruta became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, taro root seedlings, banana root seedling, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, and chemicals

loans.name: Vaiteelagi

texts.en:
A loan amount of 3,000 WST will help Vaiteelagi to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, knife, shovel, chainsaw, hand gloves, and safety boots to help her run the business. 

Vaiteelagi is a Samoan citizen, and she is 33 years old with one child. She became a member of SPBD in 2010. She will use her profits to expand her business and assist her family.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, knife, shovel, chainsaw, hand gloves, and safety boots.

loans.name: Metala

texts.en:
Metala is a 31-year-old, single woman with three children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Metala needs a loan to buy bags of flour, yeast, baking soda, baking trays, mittens and mince. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Metala has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, baking soda, baking trays, mittens and mince.

loans.name: Tumuai

texts.en:
Tumuai is a 30-year-old, single woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tumuai needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tumuai has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en: Kuini is a 55-year-old widow with six children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Kuini needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, kava bowls, coconut carved earrings and singlets. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, kava bowls, coconut carved earrings and singlets

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 42-year-old, mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Theresa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and container to assist her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to build small a bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and container.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Clarisse est une femme mariée qui vit avec quatre enfants à Adakpamé Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Clarisse vend de la boisson locale dans le quartier. Clarisse réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des bidons de boissons, Clarisse demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Clarisse is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four who lives in Adakpame. In order to provide for her children's well-being, Clarissa sells local beverages in her neighborhood. This is how she makes a living. She stocks up twice a month at the market. In order to buy some jugs of beverages, Clarisse is requesting this loan to pay for her order and have a profit margin allowing her to make a higher contribution to the household budget.

loans.use: to buy five jugs of local beverages.

loans.name: Ekueta

texts.en:
Ekueta is a 57-year-old with six children. She runs a small business of selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Ekueta has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, a coolio, a container, and a freezer to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, a coolio, a container, and a freezer.

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is 53 years old and married with 10 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Rula needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Rula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade.

loans.name: Samira Aden

texts.en:
Samira is an 18-year-old, and she lives in Hargeisa. She has a shop where she sells sugar, rice, drinks, etc. She is a single, responsible hardworking girl, and she opened her shop in 2011 with amount of $500. Her father is jobless, so she pays her brothers and sisters school fees. Her family consists of 15 children, and six boys and five girls go to schools. 

She needs to expand her shop and has requested a loan of USD 600 from Kaaba, and now she is on the wait list. Kaaba will provide the goods as a loan, and Samira will then make monthly repayments.

loans.use: to expand her shop.

loans.name: Agbassi

texts.fr: Agbassi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adakpamé. Agée de 45 ans et mère de huit enfants, Agbassi est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales et expose aussi des charbons de bois. Grâce à ce commerce, Agbassi trouve son revenu afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille. Agbassi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un sac de maïs, un carton de poisson et des paniers de tomates, Agbassi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice.
texts.en: Agbassi is a married woman living in Adakpame. She is 45 years old and has eight children. Agbassi sells staple foods as well as charcoal. Thanks to this business, Agbassi earns a revenue allowing her to provide for her family's needs. She stocks up at the market four times a month. In order to place an order for a bag of corn, a box of fish and some baskets of tomatoes, Agbassi is requesting this loan to stock up on goods for sale and help pay for her children's education thanks to her revenues.

loans.use: to buy one bag of corn, one box of fish and four baskets of tomatoes.

loans.name: Pua

texts.en:
A loan amount of 1,500 WST will help Pua to buy a lawn-mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, a safety uniform, safety boots, and hand gloves to help her maintain the good services of her business of cutting grass. She has had this experience for more than a year. 

Pua is 27 years old with one child. She will use her profits to expand her business. Pua became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, a safety uniform, safety boots, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 59-year-old, single woman with one child. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Ana needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ana has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Atalani

texts.en: Atalani is a 53-year-old mother with six children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Atalani requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage and plastic bags to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than three years. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage and plastic bags

loans.name: Vi

texts.en: Vi is 66 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Vi needs a loan to buy snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, a bag of flour, rice, sugar, salt and cigarettes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, a bag of flour, rice, sugar, salt and cigarettes

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 44 years old and single with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Mele needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, new gloves, boots and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Mele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, new gloves, boots and new overalls.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is 62 years old and married with seven children. 

Fenumiai owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 14 years. 

Fenumiai needs a loan to buy a whole box of cigarettes, cases of beer, snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks and also to pay for her beer license. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2001 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a whole box of cigarettes, cases of beer, snacks, frozen goods, softdrinks and also to pay for her beer license

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Cristina, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 33, 23, 21 y 9 años de edad, tres son mayores de edad e independientes y uno estudia en la escuela. Ella vive en casa propia.
Doña Cristina se dedica a la venta de productos de AVON (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y hace recargas telefónicas en el mercado central todos los días por 8 horas, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son las recargas ya que siempre hay promociones.
Este crédito es para comprar recargas telefónicas y productos Avon. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 11 años y le gusta por la responsabilidad de las socias a la hora de hacer los pagos y de la fundación le gustan todos los beneficios que tienen.  Su sueño es  ser una empresaria independiente.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province in Ecuador.  It is known for being the first and oldest Ecuadorian city, it is nestled in the coastal region, and is gaining ground in tourism because the area has beaches, cities, and countryside.

This place is where Señora Cristina lives.  She is 46 years old and is a single mother to four children who are 33, 23, 21, and 9 years old.  Three are older and independent, and one attends school.  She lives in her own home.

Doña Cristina makes a living selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women) and credit for prepaid mobile phones in the central market every day for eight hours.  She sells her products on credit and collects it every eight days.  She has dedicated herself to this job for a year and it is going very well.  What sells most are the phone credits because there are always promotions.

This loan is to purchase credit for prepaid mobile phones and Avon products.  Cristina has been in the Credit Group for 11 years and likes it because the members are responsible and make the repayments on time.  And she likes the institution for all the benefits it has.  Her dream is to become an independent businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy credit for prepaid mobile phones and Avon products.

loans.name: Malamalama

texts.en:
Malamalama is 55 years old with four children. 

Malamalama runs a business selling taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. She has had this experience for more than a year. 

Malamalama requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, chemicals and a wheelbarrow to help her run her business. 

Malamalama joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, chemicals and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is 35 years old with five children, She runs a business cutting grass in her community to earn a living. Mariana hopes to gain more profit from the business, and in order to do this, she has requested a loan to buy chemicals, celluloid, a safety uniform, safety boots, hand gloves, and a lawn mowing machine to help her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, celluloid, a safety uniform, safety boots, hand gloves, and a lawn mowing machine

loans.name: Haine

texts.en: Haine is a 19-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Haine needs a loan to buy cooking oil, a new oven, mince, a large pot, black pepper and a bag of salt. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Haine has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a new oven, mince, a large pot, black pepper and a bag of salt

loans.name: Lepetimalo

texts.en: A loan amount of 2,500 WST will help Lepetimalo to buy chicken, vegetable oil, a frying pan, aluminum foil, rice, a container, plastic bags, tomato sauce, and a sack of flour to help her run the business. Lepetimalo is a Samoan citizen, and is 39 years old with no children. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. She will use her profit to expand her business and assist her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetable oil, a frying pan, aluminum foil, rice, a container, plastic bags, tomato sauce, and a sack of flour

loans.name: Pagopago

texts.en:
Pagopago is a 22-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Pagopago needs a loan to buy a new frying pan, a heavy duty gas burner, a spatula, and a new gas bottle. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Pagopago has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new frying pan, a heavy duty gas burner, a spatula and a new gas bottle.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en: Sia is a 42-year-old mother with five children.  She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Sia requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Toeaso

texts.en: Toeaso is a 25 year old mother with one child.  She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Toeaso requested for a loan to buy items to assist with the business.  These include bread, tomato sauce, canned tuna, plastic bags, container, butter, and mayonnaise.  She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, canned tuna, plastic bags, container, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Sevia

texts.en: A loan amount of 1,000 WST will help Sevia to buy yeast, a sack of flour, sugar, vegetable oil, plastic bags, and a container to help her run the business. Sevia is 24 years old with one child. She operates a business of selling pancakes at the market to earn a living. She became a member of SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit to expand her business and assist her family.

loans.use: to buy yeast, a sack of flour, sugar, vegetable oil, plastic bags, and a container

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is 24 years old and single She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Emi requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, and a sack of rice to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en: A loan amount of 1,000 WST will help Faalagilagi to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and a wheelbarrow to help her run the business. Faalagilagi is 46 years old with three children. She joined SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit to expand her business and assist her family.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Adriana Rocio

texts.es:
Ella es Adriana una empresaria de 34 años de edad, madre de dos chicos menores de edad y que depende en la totalidad de su padre.
Ella es una empresaria tiene un negocio de cría de pollos y ganado porcino la cual heredo de su familia y por ende aprendió de sus padres, para empresarios como ella que vive en una zona rural es muy importante tener muchas existencias para poder llegar a un acuerdo ya que los clientes que vienen pueden encontrar muchísimas ofertas y llevarse las que mas le convenga monetariamente.

Es por esto que es muy importante un negocio bien abastecido por lo que Adriana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 100 pollos, 4 cerdos y alimento, ya que tendrá un buen inventario para trabajar y buscar siempre más y mejores ventas.

Este préstamo puede ayudar mucho a mejorar la calidad de vida ya que hay una probabilidad muy alta de que venda mucho mejor y rápido y claro todos estos esfuerzos tienen un motivo el cual es pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 34-year-old business owner who is the mother of two small children who are completely dependent on their parent.

She has a business raising chickens and pigs which she inherited from her family and therefore learned from her parents that for business people like her who live in a rural areas it is very important to have lots of stock in order to be able to have many animals to be able to make a sale, as the customers who come can find many offers and take away those that best suit them price-wise. This is why it is very important for a business to be well supplied, so Adriana wants to request a loan so that she can buy 100 chickens, 4 pigs and feed so that she will have a good inventory to work with, and always seek to improve her sales. 

This loan can really help improve her quality of life, as there is a very high probability that she will sell a lot more, and do so more quickly. Of course, all these efforts have a purpose, which is to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase 100 chickens, 4 pigs and feed so she will have a good stock to work with.

loans.name: Keen

texts.en:
Keen is a married man with six children. He is a successful businessman, having other businesses which are very successful.
He learned of Fresh life toilet through an operator near his business and developed an interest of installing the Fresh Life toilet. He says the toilet will tremendously improve the sanitation in the area where he resides. The proceeds from the toilet will go towards repaying the loan, though if not sufficient to cover the loan, then his other businesses will come in handy. He plans to pay the loan over a period of two years but intends to fully repay it before this amount of time.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 20 years old and does not have children. She runs a business of selling handicrafts at the market to earn a living. She became a member of SPBD in 2015. Julie requested a loan to buy paint, a paint brush, coconut, and sign-paper to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy paint, paint brush, coconut, and sign-paper

loans.name: Kaja B Group

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi, who is in her late 40s, is married with six children. Only one is still in school and the rest are grown up.  She has been selling fried fish for four years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaharusi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use it to increase her stock of fish and sell to more people.  She dreams of buying a big stock of fish.

Mwanaharusi will share this loan with her loan group Kaja B which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish and sell to more people.

loans.name: Nhóm 11- Tây Sơn 1 - Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tình has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items to resell.

Tình is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Tình is the group leader of the Nhóm 11- Tây Sơn 1 - Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tình joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tình has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Tình has been involved in this business for 8 years.
The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell

loans.name: 050001.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy has a retail business selling cattle feed. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed to sell.

Thủy is 25 years old and she is married with 1 child.
Thủy is the group leader of the 050001.Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Thủy has been involved in this business for 3 years.
The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle feed to sell

loans.name: 032005020002.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs Diện has a retail business selling cattle feed. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed to resell.

Diện is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. Diện is the group leader of the 032005020002.Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Diện joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Diện has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Diện has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Diện hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed to resell

loans.name: 032003040002.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sáu has a retail business selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Sáu is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children.
Sáu is the group leader of the 032003040002.Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Sáu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Sáu has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Sáu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sáu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02 - Ngô Quyền - Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make bread to sell.

Phượng is 27 years old and she is married with 1 child.
Phượng is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 - Ngô Quyền - Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Phượng has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Phượng has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fast-selling items especially for kids and to buy good quality second hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a concrete toilet with plumbing, a shower in her house to enjoy these conveniences.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions and red beans to sell to customers

loans.name: Josué

texts.es:
"Mi Prieta Linda" es el nombre de una locomotora ubicada en una la localidad conocida como "La Novia del Sol".Para los trabajadores ferroviarios esta máquina es un emblema ya que fue en ella donde laboró la primera mujer maquinista y, orgullosos, comentan que es originaria de su localidad. 

   En esta comunidad viven Josué y su familia, su esposa Noemí y su pequeño hijo de tres años de edad. La situación de desempleo lo motivó a iniciar un negocio propio, es por eso que, asociado con su tío Toño, estableció una taquería desde hace cuatro años. Ofrecen una exquisita variedad de tacos: desde los conocidos "cueritos" y "chicharrón", hasta los más  tradicionales de "barbacoa" y "pibil". Entre él y su tío preparan los ingredientes indispensables y colocan el puesto para que por la tarde ya esté lista la carne y sus clientes disfruten su sabor. La clientela es recurrente, sobre todo maestros y trabajadores de la empresa de gobierno que comercializa la energía eléctrica, tanto les gusta el servicio que ya hasta llaman a Josué “El almendro”, de cariño.
   Con el propósito de brindar la mejor calidad y el mejor servicio Josué inició con la entrega de tacos a domicilio lo que representa un mayor ingreso y, por lo tanto, mayor estabilidad económica. 
   Esta vez solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne, cebolla, chiles, cilantro y refrescos ya que las ventas aumentan favorablemente. Piensa ampliar el establecimiento en un futuro o incluso abrir una segunda taquería.
   Josué agradece la posibilidad de obtener el préstamo ya que esto representa una mejora en su calidad de vida además de independencia financiera. 

*En la fotografía aparece Josué en el negocio donde cordialmente atiende a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Mi Prieta Linda” is the name of a locomotive located in the town known as “La Novia del Sol” [The Bride of the Sun]. For those who work on the train, this locomotive is an emblem because it was where the first woman engineer worked they say, with pride, that she is from their town.

In this community lives Josué and his family—his wife, Noemí, and their three year-old son. Being unemployed motivated him to start his own business. Along with his uncle Toño, he established a taco restaurant four years ago. They serve a delicious variety of tacos: from the well-known “cueritos” and chicharron, to the more traditional barbeque and chili sauce ones. He and his uncle prepare the indispensable ingredients and set the restaurant up so that in the afternoon the meat is ready and the customers can enjoy the flavors. They have a repeat clientele, especially the teachers and the employees of the government energy company that sells electricity. They like the service so much that they already call Josué “the almond tree,” out of affection.

Josué started home delivery of the tacos with the goal of providing better quality and service. This is now the largest part of his income, and therefore his main economic stability.

This time he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of meat, onions, chiles, cilantro, and soft drinks, since his sales are increasing favorably. He plans to expand the restaurant in the future and even to open a second taco store. 

Josué is grateful for the chance to obtain a loan because it represents an improvement in his quality of life, in addition to economic independence. 

* In the photograph, Josué is pictured in his restaurant, where he tends amiably to his customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, onions, chiles, cilantro, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kaja C Group

texts.en:
Julius, who is in his early 50s, is married with six children, three of whom are at school and three of whom are grown-up.  He has been selling second-hand clothes since 2012.  He works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Julius's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his stock of second-hand clothes. Whenever he got a new loan, he has selected better quality and fast moving clothes for children.  He is doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  He used the profit to pay school fees, bought  plot of land, started building his own house, loan repayments and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy first grade second-hand clothes and meet his customers' requirements and demand.  He dreams of finishing building his house.

Julius will share this loan with his loan group Kaja C which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy first grade second-hand clothes and meet his customers' requirements and demand.

loans.name: Nhóm 03, Đồng Thọ, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Hương has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, milk, and other things. Hương has been involved in this business for 5 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

Hương is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 03, Đồng Thọ, Vạn Hòa solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2012, Hương joined the Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

loans.name: Penina

Penina requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, and a freezer to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, and a freezer

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en: Aifai is 20 years old with no children. She runs a business selling vegetables at the market to earn a living. She joined SPBD in 2015 to seek financing for her business. Aifai requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cucumber, eggplant, cabbage), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and hand gloves to assist her to run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide the family needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cucumber, eggplant, cabbage), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and hand gloves

loans.name: Ailima

texts.en: Ailima is 47 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 13 years. Ailima needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, a new machete, a crowbar, a spade and new gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Ailima will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, a new machete, a crowbar, a spade and new gloves

loans.name: Vaaiga

texts.en: Vaaiga is 20 years old with two children. She runs a business selling banana and taro in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. Vaaiga requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marcline is married with six children. They all live in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, including the sickness and death of loved ones and inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and cater to her family's needs. 

With this new loan she will  buy fowl, feeders, medicine, piglets, feed, manure, fertilizer, insecticides, water pump sprayers and seedlings. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in the agricultural field for a long time. The community will benefit from her business activity because it will provide food for the population and manure for gardeners in the local community.

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farm, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment, provide medication for her family and also build her house. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy fowl, feeders, medicine, piglets, feed, manure, fertilizer, insecticides, water pump sprayers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, mango juice, super glue and glucose biscuits.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Dilijan city with his wife and two sons, and is a farmer there. He takes care of six cows. Armen's wife helps him a lot with the farming since she is unemployed. His sons are also great help, especially in selling the farm products, which include milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese and curd. 

Armen says he dreams of a bigger farm with more cattle, which would give him the chance to earn more profit and have better living conditions for his family. With this loan, Armen wants to buy a plot of land on which he will construct a barn. He will be thankful for his loan, and in the future he will buy more cattle which he will keep in this barn.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land on which he will construct a barn

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme mariée et âgée de 24 ans qui habite Adakpamé. Akoua est mère d’un seul enfant et travaille activement pour son épanouissement. Pour trouver son revenu, Akoua vend des sceaux et objets plastiques dans le quartier et gagne son bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Akoua s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour commander des bassines et des sceaux en plastiques. Akoua souhaite augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Adakpame. She is the mother of one child and works actively for its development.

To generate her income Akoua sells buckets and plastic objects in the neighborhood and earns a profit through this activity. She resupplies four times a month and is requesting this loan to order plastic buckets and basins.

Akoua wants to increase her profit margin and ensure a good education for her child.

loans.use: buy eight plastic buckets and five plastic basins

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Matilda needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, rice, snacks and drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Matilda has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, rice, snacks and drinks

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: A 40 ans, Afiavi est une femme divorcée et avec ses cinq enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Afiavi est une marchande de chaussures qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Afiavi s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine dans un marché local. Afiavi réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Afiavi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afiavi is a 40-year-old divorcee with five children, who lives in the neighborhood of Adamavo.

Afiavi is a street vendor of shoes who sells in the streets of her neighborhood. She resupplies twice a week at a local market, and achieves very good profitability with her business.

Afiavi is requesting this loan to buy shoes so she can make profits and assist with her children's education.

loans.use: buy 23 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Abraham Forgwe

texts.en:
Abraham is married with four children and lives in a three bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life, including the death of his only brother who was very supportive to him and the family, his child refusing to go to school and preferring to stroll around the quarter during school hours, and he has also had to deal with the theft of his property.
 
He has previously taken and repaid five loans and he says with this new loan he will buy a wheelbarrow and cassava stems, repair his rice warehouse, and buy fertilizer. 

He has a positive view of business, and he succeeds because he has been doing it for a long time. With this business activity, the community members will benefit from irrigated farms, and he will also be able to spray community members rice farms.
 
With the profit from this loan, he will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with three meals, pay for his family's medication, pay for his children’s' education, and provide them with other basic necessities. He will also put back some profits into the business and do repairs on his house. 

He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow and cassava stems, repair his rice warehouse, and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 59 years old and she lives in Dilijan city with her husband (a pensioner) and her son, who works as an electrician.  Anahit has a higher pedagogical education and works at a school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature.  She is highly respected both as a teacher and a person, and is beloved at the school where she works. 

Anahit is asking for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a new refrigerator.  Her old refrigerator has broken down and it is impossible to repair and use again.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator since her old refrigerator has broken down.

loans.name: Silder

texts.en:
Silder is married and blessed with two children who go to school. The family lives in a two-bedroom house in North-West Region of Cameroon. Because she did not go to school, life has been very difficult for her. It is hard for her to feed and educate her children adequately, and she hates thinking about the death of her family members.

Silder was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been members since 2000. She has successfully borrowed and repaid fifteen prior loans. She is now applying for a 500,000 XAF loan through Kiva’s field partner GHAPE to buy red oil, firewood, corn and other food items to sell.

Silder knows this loan will be profitable for her because she has acquired some basic training in finance management and help in establishing a good business from GHAPE. Her business will actively help the community by providing it with basic necessities and so making development more possible.

Silder plans to use the profits from this loan to help pay tuition fees for her children and provide her family with food and daily necessities. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the finance management courses it offers its members.

loans.use: to buy red oil, firewood, corn and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en: Taliilagi is a Samoan citizen. She is 42 years old with five children. She operates a business selling taro and banana in her community to earn a living. She joined SPBD in 2010. Taliilagi requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a chainsaw, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a chainsaw, and hand gloves

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara lives with her family in the city of Dilijan. She lives with her husband, daughter and parents-in-law. Her son is in military service now with the army.  Lamara used to work for many years as a tailor. Now she is a laundry worker.  Her husband is a builder. 

Lamara and her husband have been married for 20 years, and they live in a house which has not been repaired in nearly 30 years.  Lamara is asking for this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams.  With this loan and their family savings of many years, they will manage to do repairs on their house, which is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to do repairs on her house, which is in very poor condition.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 38 years old and lives with her son, mother and sister in Dilijan city.  Susanna graduated from the college of physical education.  For several years she worked at the café as a waitress, and just two years ago started working in her specialty.  She now works as a coach at the sports school. Susanna’s sister is a waitress at the restaurant, her mother is a pensioner, and her son is in the army.  

Susanna asks for this loan as she wants to buy home appliances for their cute flat.  All her family is thankful in advance, should Kiva lenders decide to support them in their loan request.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for their cute flat

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr lives in the frontier village, Khashtarak of Tavush region. He lives here with his wife, two children and his retired mother. Since 2000 he has worked as a mechanic and simultaneously runs farming and agriculture. On his farm Aleksandr has cows, calves, a heifer, a pig, and beehives. On his large plot of land he cultivates potatoes, greens, peppers, tomatoes and cucumbers.  He also has a nice orchard where he has apple, fig, plum and apricot trees. Aleksandr's wife sells all his farm goods at the city’s wholesale market. His farm’s honey is sold directly from the farm to existing customers. 

Aleksandr asks for this loan to develop swine breeding on his farm, and also to buy several piglets and fodder for his cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and fodder for his cattle farm.

loans.name: Adoté

texts.fr: Cet homme fait un commerce d’un genre particulier : il achète des pâtes dentifrices, des produits cosmétiques et autres produits chez les grossistes achetant à l'extérieur(Europe et États-Unis). Il a débuté cette activité il y a 07ans,est marié et père de famille. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il souhaite agrandir son activité et améliorer le niveau de vie d la famille.
texts.en:
This man runs a very particular type of business.  He buys toothpaste, cosmetic products and other products from wholesalers outside his country (in Europe and the USA).  He began his business seven years ago and it allows him to provide for the needs of his family.  He is a married man with children.

In the future, he would like to expand his business and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, cosmetic and other products for sale.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is 51 years old and he lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region with his wife and two sons. 

Ararat is a farmer and he is also seriously engaged in bee keeping. Before, he used to work at his city's very famous carpet factory, but after the collapse of the Soviet Union the factory closed, and then he started his farming activities. Now in his farm he has beehives, chickens and rabbits. He also has a nice orchard which gives a harvest of persimmon. Ararat also grows thuja trees and sells them to his regular customers. He manages all these farm activities with the help of his family members. 

Now he wants to develop his bee keeping activities, and with this loan amount he plans to buy several bee colonies for his farm.

loans.use: to buy several bee colonies for his farm in order to develop his bee keeping activities

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is a young 26-year-old farmer who lives in a frontier village in the Tavush region with her husband, three children and parents-in-law. 

Astghik’s husband has a small food market and he works there all day long. Other members of her family are also employed and she alone takes care of their rather big and productive farm. Here she takes care of a pig, piglets and chickens. She also has a nice orchard with a harvest of persimmon, apple and apricot. She sells all her farm goods at the wholesale market. She says that even though her family members are employed, farming brings in the main income for her family. 

Astghik is asking for this Kiva loan as at the moment her piglets are lacking fodder. She wants to buy a lot of fodder for her farm pigs.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her farm pigs, as at the moment her piglets are lacking fodder

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 31 ans, Akouvi est une femme avec un enfant à sa charge. Akouvi habite à Adamavo et est une commerçante de produits d’alimentations générales au marché. Akouvi réalise favorablement son activité et pour arriver à ses fins, elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des tas d’oignons et de légumes, Akouvi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin de promouvoir l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 31 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in Adamavo and sells food at the market.  She buys new supplies three times a month from the market, and makes a reasonable living from her business.

Akouvi has requested this loan to buy onions and other vegetables.  Her earnings will pay for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy 1 load of onions and 2 loads of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Tujimbere Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe  Tujimbere et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 50 ans et elle veuve. Elle a  3 enfants âgés de 12 à 20 ans, tous étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants orphelins.

Elle fait le commerce de chèvres  depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son vingtième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a member of the Tujimbere Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 50 years old, widowed and has three children aged from twelve to twenty years.  All of her children currently attend school.  She is also responsible for two orphaned children.

Béatrice has been buying and selling goats for fifteen years.  This will be her twentieth loan from the field partner, Turame.  She will use it to increase her working captial and buy many goats to raise and sell on.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy many goats to raise.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 46 years old and lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. Her husband is working abroad.
 
Siranush is busy with farming and also with the sale of her farm products such as milk, meat and eggs. Her son runs cargo services with his own truck and this also contributes to the family income.  

With this loan Siranush wants to help her son financially to solve some problems concerning his truck. With the loan amount she will buy tires for the truck, and also some spare parts.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for her son's truck

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Afiwavi  est une femme mariée vivant à Adamavo avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Afiwavi est très dynamique et vend des fruits pour satisafire favorablement ses clients. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Afiwavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Afiwavi demande ce crédit pour commander des paniers de bananes, d’ananas et des oranges pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en:
Afiwavi is 29 years old, married and lives in Adamavo with her two children.  She is a very dynamic woman and sells fruits.  Her business allows her to provide for the needs of her family.  She buys her supplies four times a month from the market.  

Afiwavi has requested this loan to buy baskets of bananas, pineapples and oranges to generate a profit which will provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of bananas, 40 pineapples and 20 quantities of oranges.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: A 34 ans, Amélé est une femme mariée et avec ses deux enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Amélé est une revendeuse de fruits qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Amélé s’approvisionne huit fois par mois dans un marché local. Amélé réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Pour acheter des paniers de bananes, des tas d’oranges et d’avocat, Amélé nécessite ce crédit pour favoriser sa commande afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amélé is 34 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in the Adamavo district.  She sells fruit on foot in her local neighbourhood.

Amélé buys new supplies eight times a month from a local market.  She makes a good living from her business and will use her loan to buy more bananas, oranges and avocadoes.  This will improve her profits and allow her to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of bananas, 10 quantities of oranges and 6 quantities of avocadoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African clothing)

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives with his family and pigs in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. 

He is a farmer and on his farm he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, a heifer, sheep and chickens. His plot of land gives a good harvest of potatoes, which he sells and which is rather profitable for him. Therefore he spends a lot of time on his land cultivation as it brings in a good profit for his family. His wife sells their farm products (milk, meat and eggs) to their neighbors, but Sargis sells their farm potatoes at the wholesale market, mainly to re-sellers. 

Since the potato sales are very profitable, Sargis wants to use this loan for the development his potato production.

loans.use: to develop his potato production on his plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pagnes  (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Casa De Dios Group

texts.es:
"La Novia del Sol" es una comunidad veracruzana célebre por su clima caluroso, por lo que no es extraño ver que los habitantes disfruten y se refresquen con su familia en alguno de los cinco balnearios, o bien en uno de los diez ríos locales. 

   Casa de Dios es un grupo conformado por habitantes de dicha localidad, y el nombre lo eligieron debido a la fe que profesan, ellos son doce integrantes: Benita vende carne de cerdo, repostería y cosméticos; Alida, calzado y cosméticos; Ruth, artículos de plata  y cosméticos además de criar cerdos; Aracely, ropa; Odilia, perfumes; Antonio y Josué, tacos; Rocío, gelatinas, hielitos y refrescos. De igual modo Blanca realiza tejidos; José hace tortillas y es fotógrafo; mientras que Guadalupe maneja una tienda de abarrotes y Blanca Isabel, una estética.

   Para Isabel el estilismo es una pasión que desarrolló desde muy pequeña: “desde niña siento amor por el servicio de estética, jugaba con mis muñecas a cortarles el cabello, peinarlas o maquillarlas”. Posteriormente estudió en una academia de belleza en donde perfeccionó su técnica con base en la práctica. 
   Desde hace siete años construyó, con la ayuda de sus padres, su propio negocio, que abre de nueve de la mañana a nueve de la noche. Chabe, como es mejor conocida, brinda servicio de cortes de cabello, manicura, pedicura, depilaciones y tines además de ofrecer servicio a domicilio. 
   Gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar materiales y mobiliario indispensable para su negocio; pero lo más importante es que ayuda a su madre con los gastos de la casa. En esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en la compra de tintes, peróxido, cremas, peines, acrílico, una secadora y una silla para niños. Asimismo planea remodelar la estética e instalar aire acondicionado para mejorar el ambiente en el establecimiento. 
   El grupo Casa de Dios agradece esta gran oportunidad con la cual pueden mejorar su calidad de vida. Chabe agradece en especial el apoyo que se le ha brindado pues con ello ha realizado el sueño de tener su propio negocio. 

*La fotografía se tomó en la estética de Isabel quien viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
"La Novia del Sol" (bride of the sun) is a community in Veracruz known for its warm climate.  So it is not strange that the local people enjoy refreshing moments with their families in one of the five spas or ten local rivers.

The communal bank "Casa de Dios" is a group made up of people from this community.  They chose the name because of their faith.  There are 12 members: Benita who sells pork, bakery products and cosmetics; Alida, shoes and cosmetics; Ruth, silver items and cosmetics, and raising pigs; Aracely, clothing; Odilia, perfumes; Antonio and Joshue, tacos; Rocio, jello, ice and refreshments.  Other members are Blanca who weaves, Jose who makes tortillas and is a photographer; and Guadalupe who runs a grocery store; and Blanca Isabel who is an esthetician.

Being a stylist is a passion Isabel has developed since she was very young:  "Ever since I was a little girl I have loved my profession.  I used to play with my dolls and cut and style their haird and put make up on them".  Later she would attend beauty school where she learned the technique based on practice.

Seven years ago, with the help of her parents, she started her own business which opens at 9:00 a.m. and closes at 9:00 p.m.  Chabe, as she is better known, offers hair cuts, manicure, pedicure, hair removal and hair color, and also provides in-home services.

With the profits she has earned she has been able to buy necessary materials and furniture for her business.  But most importantly she has been able to help her mother with the household expenses.  On this occasion she will use the loan to buy hair color, peroxide, creams, combs, acrylic, a dryer and a chair for children.  She also plans to renovate the salon and install air conditioning to improve the environment.

The Casa de Dios group is grateful for this great opportunity to improve their quality of life.  Chabe is especially grateful for the support she has received which has allowed her to realize her dream of having her own business.

*This picture was taken at Isabel's salon.  She is wearing a red top.

loans.use: To buy hair color, peroxide, creams, combs, acrylic, a dryer and a chair for children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new letrine since the one she has is full and not usable.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 29  años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de su mamá  en la cual vive también una tía y su abuela.
Doña María es comerciante de verduras (pepinos, lechugas, zanahorias, tomate, etc.) Este es un negocio familiar que tiene muchos años y también vende ropa en forma ambulantetiene aproximadamente 1 año, trabaja sola 4 horas de lunes a sábados.  
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar frutas, verduras y ropa. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años y le gusta porque las charles le han enseñado mucho en su vida diaria y de la fundación que los créditos son rápidos y sin tanto papeleo. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabi in Ecuador.  It is known for being the oldest city in the coastal region and is advancing as a tourist area because of its beach, city and countryside.

This is where Maria, 29, lives.  She is single and lives with her mother, an aunt and her grandmother.  Maria is a merchant and sells vegetables (cucumbers, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, etc.).  It is a long-standing family business.  She also works as a street vendor selling clothing and has been in business a year.  She works alone Monday through Saturday, four hours a day.

She will use this loan to buy fruit, vegetables and clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank group for five years, and she enjoys the seminars that teach about daily life.  She also likes the fact that the loans can be obtained quickly without a lot of paperwork.  Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and clothing.

loans.name: Janny Marilis

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 22, 17, 15 y 11 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jenny y su esposo se dedican a la fabricación y venta de tortillas de maíz o de yuca,  ella prepara las tortillas en su casa y su marido se encarga de llevarlas a  vender por la ciudad y en los buses de transporte y en el terminal de buses de la ciudad en la cual tiene muchos clientes, allí  él se sube  a los buses que se desplazan a otras ciudades y realiza sus ventas,  llevan más de 15 años con este negocio el cual les da lo necesario para salir adelante, todo les fue más fácil desde el día que recibe los créditos, razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar maíz, yuca, queso y otros ingredientes necesarios para elaborar sus tortillas. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Los Andes loan group meets every fortnight in an area known as El Guabito. It is in the city of Portoviejo, a place where the people are friendly, hard-working, and committed to their families.

And it is here that 39-year-old Jenny lives. She has a partner and four children, ages 22, 17, 15 and 11 years old. The two youngest are in school. Jenny’s partner is a trader.

Jenny and her partner make a living producing and selling corn and yucca tortillas. Jenny prepares the tortillas at home while her husband is in charge of taking them out to sell in the city, on public transportation and at the bus station, where the couple has many customers. Jenny’s husbands gets on the buses travelling to other cities to make his sales. The couple has had this business for 15 years and it provides them with what they need in order to get ahead. Everything has been much easier since they started receiving loans and they are very grateful for them.

This new loan will be used to buy corn, yucca, cheese and other ingredients for preparing tortillas. This is Jenny’s fifth loan cycle with the loan group and she likes it as the loans are a great help. Jenny’s dream is to give her children the best in life that she can.

loans.use: to buy corn, yucca, cheese and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mildred Yajaira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Mildred, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años  de edad,  el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Mildred se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, con el crédito anterior ella comenzó un negocio en su casa, ella adecuo un local en el cual vende frutas y legumbres, este negocio le está dejando muy buenas ganancias y así ella está más tiempo en su casa trabajando y al mismo tiempo al tanto de sus hijos, aunque aún sigue saliendo en sus ratos libres a vender sus zapatos y ropa ya que es algo que no le quita mucho tiempo y le deja buenos ingresos. Ella está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le permiten recibir su crédito ya que así ella mejora su vida
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas, legumbres, ropa y zapatos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su vida. Sus sueños es aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Los Andes loan group meets every fortnight in an area known as El Guabito. It is in the city of Portoviejo, a place where the people are friendly, hard-working, and committed to their families.

And it is here that 33-year-old Mildred lives. She is married and has two children, ages seven and two years old; the eldest is in school. Mildred’s husband is a builder.

Mildred makes a living selling all types of shoes and clothes. She used her previous loan to start a business in her home. She set up a space where she could sell fruits and vegetables, and this business is providing her with very good profits. It also means that she is at home working a lot, which means that she can also look after her children. Nonetheless, she goes out every so often to sell shoes and clothes, a job that does not take up too much time and provides a good income. 

Mildred is very grateful to the microfinance organisation and to the people who make the loans possible as they have made her life better.

This loan will be used to buy fruits vegetables, clothes and shoes. Mildred is a founding member of the loan group and likes it as the loans help her to improve her business. Mildred’s dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits vegetables, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to dig and install larger pipes that will take waste water from her house to the sewer trap on the street.

loans.name: Cristina Liceth

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera, está ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Cristina, tiene 22 años de edad y está divorciada, tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Viven en casa de la mamá
Doña Cristina es impulsadora de productos farmacéuticos en la zona de Manabí, también se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de la semana ocho horas diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene algún tiempo a estas actividades y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta en el grupo de crédito por 6 años y le gusta la responsabilidad de grupo en la hora de hacer los pagos. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y ser totalmente independiente.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabi in Ecuador. It is known for being the oldest city in the coastal region and is advancing as a tourist area because of its beach, city and countryside.

This is where Cristina, 22, lives.  She is divorced and has a six-year-old son who attends school.  They live with her mother.  Cristina is a pharmaceutical sales representative in the Manabi region, and she also sells natural products and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works every day of the week, eight hours a day, selling on a credit basis and collecting payment every eight days.

For some time she has been conducting her business and it has gone very well for her.  What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  She has been a member of the communal bank for six years, and she enjoys the fact that it is a group responsibility to repay the loan.  Her dream is to have her own business and become totally independent.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy tubers

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 1 y 5 años, está linda familia vive en Sololá.
Eva para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica al servicio de trasporte desde hace 2 años.
Eva ahora se ve a la necesidad de comprar media cuerda de terreno para su cultivo por tal razón solicita este crédito.
Eva espera poder contar con el prestamo para poder comprar su terreno y que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Eva is 22 years old, single and has a lovely family with two children, ages one and five.  They live in Solola.

Eva supports her family by working in transportation services which she has been doing for two years.  

Now she is requesting a loan to buy cropland.  She wants her children to become great professionals.

loans.use: To buy cropland.

loans.name: Sandy Rosalia

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera, está ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosalía, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 4 y 1 año, tres estudian en la escuela. El cónyuge es comerciante ambulante de accesorios telefónicos. 
Doña Rosalía  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, ahí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 23h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene cinco años con esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio. Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabi in Ecuador. It is known for being the oldest city in the coastal region and is advancing as a tourist area because of its beach, city and countryside.

This is where Rosalia, 26, lives.  She is in a common-law relationship and has four children, ages 11, nine, four and one.  Three of them attend school.  Her husband is a street vendor and sells phone accessories.

Rosalia has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables and fruit.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. and sometimes even later.  She enjoys her work because it keeps her busy and she also finds out about what is going on in the neighborhood.  She has been in business for five years and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic products.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes the fact that the loans have helped her grow her business.  Her dream is to see her children grow and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage and other basic products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fresh fish

loans.name: Dolores Vicenta

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 45  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6  hijos, cinco son mayores de edad e independientes y una de 14 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciantes de legumbres. Viven en casa propia.
Doña se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y productos de Leonisa (productos de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar  ropa interior y ropa. Esta en el grupo De Crédito dos años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es que el negocio crezca y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. It's known for being the first Ecuadorian city, the oldest one of the coastal region.  It is gaining populariy for tourism since it has a beach, city, and countryside.  Mrs. Dolores lives here.  She's 45 years old, married, and has 6 children, 5 of which are adults and live independently.  She also has a 14 year old daughter who attends school.  
Her huband sells vegetables.  Mrs. Dolores sells clothes by catalogue and Leonisa products (underwear for men, women, and children).  She works three days a week for 2-3 hours a day.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment every eight days.  She's been working on this for 5 years and so far the business is very good.  They own the house ion which they live.  
This loan is to buy underwear and other clothing items.  She's been in the credit group for 2 years and she likes it because of the low interests.  Her dream is for her business to grow and to remain in good health.

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothes.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Desde que inició su pulpería, Josefa se convirtió en una mujer más activa e independiente. El hecho de generar ganancias sin descuidar su familia, la llena de satisfacción y la motiva a seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.  Inició con mil córdobas  y poco apoco ha  multiplico ese capital, hasta convertirse en una pulpería próspera y rentable.  

Sin embargo, solicita un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, leche, gaseosa, salsa de tomate, papel higiénico, huevo, entre otros. Lo cual le ayudará a ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, en consiguiente aumentará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Since opening her convenience store, Josefa has become a more active and independent woman.  The fact that she's able to generate an income while still taking care of her family is a source of satisfaction and motivates her to keep investing in her business.  She started with 1000 Cordobas and slowly she's been able to multiply that capital until making of the store a successful and profitable venture.  
However, she's requesting a loan to buy basic grains, candy, milk, sodas, tomato sauce, tissue paper, eggs, among other items.  This will help her have a greater variety of products which will result in higher income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, milk, sodas, tomato sauce, tissue paper, eggs, among other items.

loans.name: Syafrohmanuddin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Syafrohmanuddin. Syafrohmanuddin lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. Syafrohmanuddin owns a stall that provides mobile payment services for his community.  He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn more about how to improve his business using technology. His community sees Syafrohmanuddin as a friendly person, that’s why it’s really easy for him to attract customers.
 
Syafrohmanuddin has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called 'Mapan'.
