She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of milk in bulk, so that she can improve each day with her sales, and with the income that she has, be able to continue helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase milk in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single young man from Nablus city in Palestine. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father works in the transfer of goods using his car. 

Mohammad is a second year student in the university. He wants to open his own business and be independent, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy machines and cleaning products so he can open a car wash store. This loan will help him to open his own business and improve himself. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy machines and cleaning products so he can open his own car wash store.

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en:
Sieni is a 51-year-old mother with three children. She has a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. 

Sieni requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measurement to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measurement

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Allen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Allen has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 37 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children are still in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.  Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 52 years old and she lives with her husband and son in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region.  

Anahit works at the hospital as a sanitarian. Her husband and son do different construction work in their village. Anyway, being so busy all day long and being so tired after her work, Anahit perfectly takes care of her farm animals such as cows, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. She sells good milk, tasty cheese, fresh meat and eggs. Her husband and son help her in land cultivation work. The potatoes that they gather from the land are very tasty and they are quickly sold right from their house to re-sellers. 

Now Anahit asks for this loan, as she needs it to buy fertilizer for her land; also she will buy a calf and fodder for all her farm cattle. In this way, she is trying to develop both her agricultural and farming activities.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two sons. Both sons are receiving education and are in different grades. Maya is married to Sailen, who is a farmer. She lives in Falakata, in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal, India. She has received a primary education but her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name. 

Her husband cultivates seasonal crops and vegetables on their farmland. Maya is a homemaker and also helps her husband in the farming. They usually sell the crops and vegetables in the local market, which is their only source of income. Now they decided to cultivate maize because this is a very profitable and in-demand crop now.

As Maya needs additional capital to purchase maize seeds, fertilizers etc., she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. This will allow her to cultivate maize on her farmland and increase her monthly turnover.  This way, she can increase the productivity of her business and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family a secure life.

She conveys her hearty thanks to the lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Chabi

texts.en:
Chabi is a rural woman from Falakata. She is 32 years old and a mother of three daughters. Unfortunately, she lost her husband and is struggling to run her family. She lives in a small village in Falakata, Alipurduar district.  

As Chabi attended school till grade 8 and could not continue further due to her parents' monetary problems, her first priority is providing education to all her daughters. They are reading in grade 9, 6 and 3.

She works hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She engages herself in agriculture activities to run the family. She grows different types of crops and sells them in the local market. Her customers are local peoples and neighbors. 

To cope with the increasing price of essential commodities, she needs to cultivate more crops to generate more income. So now she has decided to cultivate maize in her farmland as the crop has a high demand in the market.

In order to purchase maize seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Chabi applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This would help her to grow maize crops, which will ultimately help her in generating more income.

She hopes to purchase more farmland in the future to cultivate more crops, which will generate more profit so that she can give a secure life to her daughters.

Chabi is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies in order to grow maize in her farmland.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a married woman of 29 years. She lives in Falakata, in the Alipurduar district with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her children go to the local village school; they are in grade 6 and grade 1.

Swapna's husband, Mano Ranjan, is associated with agricultural activities. He grows various seasonal crops in his field. He has good knowledge and experience about cultivation. Swapna also engages herself in this business. They have their own plot of land where they work from dawn to dusk.  

Her goal is to move ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her family. Now they have decided to cultivate maize, which is a profitable crop and it is the best season to grow this crop. So they hope to achieve a good profit from this cultivation. But they lack capital to invest in their business.

Swapna heard that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives business loans to needy rural women. She took a loan from them with an aim to cultivate maize. She wants to use the loan to buy planting materials and fertilizer to start the cultivation. She is striving for a better life through farming. Swapna hopes to have a better life with her family in future.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating maize.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 53 years old; she is married with five children.

Apolonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods noodles, spices, milk, coffee, etc.

Apolonia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising cattle .

Apolonia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina is 36 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child is still in school.

Cerina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cerina has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 22-year-old single man from a small village near Bethlehem. He lives with his family in a simple humble house. 

Three years ago, Rami began his work in the interior decoration for homes; he has a passion to develop his work. 

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN to buy new tools to help him in the work of gypsum (sheetrock). 

After taking this loan he will increase the attractiveness of his work and increasing demand for it.

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools to help him in the work of gypsum (sheetrock)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 55 years old and married with two children. For the past 10 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from raising cattle. Estela works hard to provide for her family. 

Estela is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, coffee, milk, spices, and other products. She has borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF. In the future, Estela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, coffee, milk, and spices

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has operated her business for four years. 

Hermenia is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are still in school. For the past three years, Jocelyn has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed five previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jocelyn is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies

loans.name: Ma.elena

texts.en:
Ma.Elena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma.Elena is 44 years old and has four children are still in school.

Ma.Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She  requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma.Elena has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 60 years old and married with three children. Concordia works very hard to provide for them.

Concordia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, bread, drinks and other personal care products. Concordia has been in this business for 40 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, bread, drinks and other personal care products.

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn is 30 years old and married with three children. With three children are still in school, Ma. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like milk, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods and other personal care products.

Ma. Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like milk, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods and other personal care products

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children that are currently in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle. Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and she also earns additional income from her general store. She has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a married woman of 43 years. She lives in a small mud house with her family in rural West Bengal, India. She is the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). 

Putul's husband is a farmer. He cultivates varieties of seasonal crops in his farmland according to the market demand. After harvest he sells the products to the market at wholesale rates. Putul assists her husband in this activity, especially in the time of reaping the seedlings and harvesting. They work from dawn to dusk to give a good future to their children. 

Now they have decided to cultivate cucumbers, which have a great demand in summer season. They need some financial help to execute their plan. 

Putul came to know that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives enterprise loans to poor rural women, and she applied for a loan from them. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer to grow cucumbers. Putul hopes this loan will give a boost in their business and increase the profit. 

She is appreciative to both BJS and Kiva for this financial aid.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate cucumbers.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 34, is the mother of two children and lives in Battambang province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows cassava and works for other farmers  for a fee. 

Now she has not enough money to run the farm, so she applies for this loan in order to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and have the ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fees and to use the profits to expand her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy desks, stationary, and other stuff she needs for her new business.

loans.name: Mbyja Koe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mbyja Koe está integrado  por  17 mujeres, está en  el 5°  ciclo, está dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ponen su esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dominga, quien se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, comenta que poco a poco y por medio de su esfuerzo se ha hecho camino para tener hoy muchos clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de forrajes, balanceados y otro, para poder alimentar a sus vacas, y con ello poder seguir con la producción de leche. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Mbyja Koe is comprised of seventeen women, this is their fifth cycle. They are part of the women's committee program, where everyone makes an effort to get ahead. 
One of the members is Dominga, who sells cheese and milk. She remarks that little by little, through her efforts she has been able to reach the point now where she has many customers. She is a very hard-working person, who tries hard to grow. 
She is requesting this loan to buy fodder, compound feed and other products to be able to feed her cows, and continue producing milk. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given to be able to better herself and help out her family.

loans.use: to buy fodder, compound animal feed, and more to feed cows for producing milk

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Fatima es un grupo integrado  por  17 mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan  ya que   se encuentran en el mismo Barrio.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Genara, quien se dedica a la confección de sabanas y fundas de todos los tamaños que lleva al exterior y al interior para su comercialización, comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela y que con su trabajo y sus ventas va mejorando para ayudar a su familia.
Genara pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, para poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Virgen de Fatima is a group that is made up of 17 women. It is a new group, in which, all the women work and support each other. They all meet in the same neighborhood. 

One of the group members is Genara, who makes a living producing sheets and pillowcases of all sizes to sell both locally and outside of her region. She has a good customer base and as her work and sales are increasing, she is able to help her family. 

Genara is requesting this loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, rubber bands, and other items to be able to keep working. She is very grateful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, rubber bands, and other items.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 38 years old and married with two children. Two of her children are still in school and she works very hard to provide for them. For the past 18 years, Lynette has run a general store in the Philippines.

Lynette is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as milk, coffee, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, drinks, and other personal care products. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, drinks, and personal care products

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is a married woman 23 years old. She received education up to grade 9. She lives with her husband, Sujit, and one son at their own kachha house (mud and straw made) in a small village of Falakata in Alipurduar district, India. Her son reads in grade 5 in a local school in Falakata.

Kamala's husband is a farmer. He is a hardworking and very enterprising man. She assists her husband in agricultural work from dawn to dusk to grow varieties of crops according to the seasonal demand, which they sell in the local market to earn money for their livelihood. 

Now they decided to grow maize on their land, as it is a beneficial crop and also has great demand all over India. But due to lack of capital, Kamala is unable to cultivate this nutritious crop in her farmland.

Thus Kamala requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality maize seeds, fertilizers, manure etc., so that her husband can grow good quality maize on their land. 

Kamala's hopes and dreams are to expand their agribusiness to give good financial support to her family, give a better life to their son and purchase a piece of land from the profit generated from the business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and fertilizers for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song is 28 years old and the father of one child.  At present, his wife just returned to work after her maternity leave. Song came from a very poor family, so that he did not receive much formal education. He plunged into work when he was only a teenager and at that time he began to learn driving skills. 

With the help of his family, Song bought a truck two years ago and began to carry cargo, in his hometown. Song is very honest and hard-working. His business runs very well. This year, due to a bad economic situation and in order to support his family, Song has been looking for more supplies of cargo.
 
He requested ￥15000 from Microcred, which is his second loan. He has a great credit reputation. He says he will use part of the money to pay for his house rent, so that he could let his parents live better and the rest of the money will be spent on turnover of his business. Song said that with the help of Microcred, the family life will develop better and better.

loans.use: to pay house rent for his family and be invested in his transportation business

loans.name: Ragab

texts.en:
Ragab is 47 years old from Minia. He is married and has four children. He has been a plumber for 20 years and four years ago he started a bathroom supplies business.   He looks forward to expanding this project and to buy modern supplies to meet the increasing demands of his customers. 

So he requested a 2000 EGP loan to buy modern supplies such as pumps and taps.

loans.use: To buy modern supplies such as pumps and taps, for his bathroom supply business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Luchadoras 2 está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos señoras se encuentran por en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las personas que se destaca por su trabajo y su esfuerzo es la Sra. Katriana, quien se dedica a las ventas varias de mercería, tiene todo tipo de productos y es justamente por ello que tiene mucha clientela y muy variada. Katriana es una mujer muy luchadora que se está abriendo camino con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Katriana comenta que lucha por sus seres queridos para que tengan una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Luchadoras 2" (hard working women 2) is in cycle number 7 of the women's committee program where all are doing the poverty elimination survey and two of the women are found in extreme poverty.

One of the people who stands out for her work and effort is Katriana who is dedicated to selling various types of merchandise. She has all kinds of products and thus has a lot of different customers. Katriana is a very hard working woman who is making her way with a lot of work and sacrifice.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various clothing, shoes, bazaar items and other products so she can keep up with sales as she has been doing. Katriana notes that she works hard for her family so they have a dignified life without the hardships she has had to overcome.

loans.use: to buy various clothing, shoes, bazaar items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a 37 year old mother with three children. 

She runs a business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Mavis requested a loan to buy bananas, a sack of taro, a fry pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bananas, a sack of taro, a fry pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 54-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah.  She is the mother for one son and one daughter. She lives with them in a small humble house. Her son works as a painter and he is the sole source of income. 

Amna decided to work in the seamstress sector to improve her family income. She took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a sewing machine and tools, such as yarns and fabrics. This loan will help her to be independent and improve her living condition.  Amna appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and tools to improve the family income

loans.name: Nasylkan

texts.ru: Насылкан, 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Бизнес Насылкан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2,0 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Насылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nasylkan is 47 and married with three children. She has a specialist high school education and works in agriculture. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. She currently has 2 hectares of land on her farm where she grows beans and potatoes.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nasylkan has again approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase 10 sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 37 лет, замужем, 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, она целеустремленна, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 18 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров. Для содержания скота имеются все условия. Также Динара на земельной доле мерою 3,0 Га выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Dinara is 37 and married with six children. She has a high school education and is a purposeful person who knows exactly what she wants and works for it with all her strength. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 18 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has five cows on her farm as well as everything necessary to take good care of them. She also has 3 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Dinara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase 10 sheep to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her herd and wants to save toward building a barn for her animals.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a 40-year-old married rural woman from Falakata in the Alipurduar district. She lives there with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Unfortunately, both Rahima and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only. Despite that, they have keen interest to educate their children. So she sends her children to school. 

Rahima is a homemaker who looks after her children and does all the household work. Her husband, 42 years old, is a cycle van puller who rents a cycle van from a local owner. Like a rickshaw and an auto, a cycle van is a kind of transport that carries people and goods from one place to another, especially in remote areas.

His income is very inconsistent. As he is the only income generator of his family, from the beginning Rahima faced many problems trying to pay the household expenses along with her children’s education expenses.  

Rahima hopes the family income will increase if she can purchase a cycle van for her husband. At this crucial time she came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase a cycle van. She hopes their condition will improve from the earlier situation. Her goal is to purchase a Toto van (one type of van that runs through battery, especially in rural areas).

Rahima is thankful to her generous lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 39-year-old rural woman who lives at Parengerpar village in Falakata, in the Alipurduar district. She lives there with her husband and three sons. Two of her sons are in grades 9 and 8 and one of them is engaged a carpentry business. 

She and her husband are daily laborers by profession. Both of them are illiterate and only able to sign their names.

Aliya’s son makes wooden furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, wardrobes, etc. as per customers' orders. In order to manufacture the furniture he requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, paint and good tools. Therefore, Aliya wants to access a loan to invest money to buy all the required materials for the carpentry work. The family’s income depends on this business. 

With the intention of improving the situation, Aliya hopes that a loan will make it possible for her son to buy good-quality wood to fulfill his customers' orders. So Aliya has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). 

Aliya hopes that the loan amount will allow her son to supply the orders on time. She also hopes that this business will generate enough income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead.

Aliya is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase good-quality wood and other materials for her son's small-scale carpentry business.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali, 29, is a hardworking entrepreneur. She is raising her one son along with her husband. They live in a remote region in the district of Alipurduar. 
Shyamali’s husband is engaged in a clothing business. In order to provide additional income Shyamali is also trying to do some business of her own for the betterment of the family. She is involved in animal husbandry. She rears cows and sells milk in her neighborhood. 

Now, she wants to buy another cow and forage as well as medicine for her cattle. She wants to develop her milk-selling business to raise her family's income. She has chosen this business as milk is in great demand in rural areas. 

She applied for a loan to invest in her business to buy a dairy cow.

She hopes that this will increase her business to give a decent and financially strong lifestyle to her family. In future, she wants to increase her domestic livestock quantities and make a cowshed.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and forage as well as medicine for her dairy business.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is 30 years old from Minia. She is married to a part time farmer and has two children. She decided to help her husband with the family income by starting a clothing business. 

After Huda's business had become very successful and the the customers' demands increased, she wanted to expand her project to meet the increasing demands of her clients. So she requested a 4000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to increase her sales and monthly income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to increase her sales and monthly income.

loans.name: Poderosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Poderosas   está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con la esperanza de poder crecer y luchar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vicenta quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado mucho. Entre el trabajo que ella realiza es la venta de comidas, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su lucha.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The group named "Poderosas" ("the powerful women") is in cycle number 3 of the women's committee program where all work and help each other get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey with the hope of being able to grow and work hard.

One of the members is Vicenta who, in her last survey, showed a poverty level of 3, which indicates that she has improved a lot. One of the jobs she performs is selling food and she is requesting this loan to be able to buy ingredients for her food like vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments and other items so she can keep working hard. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to be someone in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Taofi

texts.en:
Taofi is a 33-year-old mother with three children. She runs a business of cooking and selling barbeque in her community to earn a living. 

Taofi requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice to help her run the business. 

She hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 20-years-old married lady from a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband in a small house. Samar's husband works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. Samar has a sewing workshop where he makes traditional pieces. She sell them in the local market. 

Samar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income.   Samar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop, to increase her productivity

loans.name: Tagreed

texts.en:
Tagreed is a 42-year-old married woman from Khanyounis city. She lives with her husband and four kids in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low and unstable income. Tagreed has a sewing workshop where she makes traditional pieces. She sells them in the local market. 

Tagreed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Tagreed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Faeda

texts.en:
Faeda is a 46-year-old married woman from Jenin City. She lives with her husband and eight kids in a small house. Her husband works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. Faeda has a sewing workshop where she makes different types of clothes. She sells her products in the local market.

Faeda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income.

Faeda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 40-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and four kids in a small house. Hanan’s husband works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low and unstable income. Hanan has a sewing workshop where she makes different types of clothing that she sells in the local market.

Hanan is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop. Her loan will help her increase her productivity and her income. Hanan appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is 27 years old from Minia. She is married and has a son. Huda and her husband started a cell phones' maintenance and accessories business using a loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on the due date. 

In their shop, her husband is responsible for the maintenance and she is responsible for sales. Huda dreams of expanding her project by purchasing accessories for modern cell phones. So she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy accessories and spare parts for modern cell phones

loans.use: To buy accessories and spare parts for modern cell phones.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est mariée et a en charge 4 enfants. Elle a 37 ans. Pour pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges, elle fait la vente de produits d'alimentation générale et de charbons  de bois. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite dans une boutique. Elle compte dans cette activité 10 ans d’expérience. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter de nouveaux marchandises.
texts.en:
Essi is married and has four children under her care. She is 37 years old.

To help her husband deal with expenses, she sells general food products and charcoal. She resupplies at the main market of Lome and resells in a shop.

She has ten years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise.

loans.use: buy general food products and charcoal

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 46 years old and from Baniswef. She is married to a part-time farmer and has four sons. 

Fatma has helped her husband in their small cattle-fattening project for more than 10 years. She started the project with one head of cattle, and now she wants to buy three more head of cattle to increase her income and help her sons with their marriage savings. She requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more cattle to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to expand her project.

loans.name: Akmaral

texts.ru: Акмарал, 20 лет, замужем, есть грудной ребенок. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи,Акмарал стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, муж помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Акмарал достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Акмарал имеется 2 коровы, 8 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает пшеницу и рис для реализации. Акмарал обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Акмарал планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Akmaral is 20 and married with one young baby. In the search for a source of income for her family, she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry with the help of her husband. Thanks to her hard work and tireless effort she has achieved great success in her work and is now receiving a monthly income of 20,000 KGS. She currently has two cows and eight sheep on her farm as well as 2 hectares of land where she grows wheat and rice for sale.

Akmaral has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which she will use to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and saving toward home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: So'ad

texts.en:
So'ad is 26 years old and from Baniswef. She is married and has one baby girl. 

Her husband is a farmer in one of the neighboring villages, but with a very small income that can't cover the family's expenses. So, So'ad started a small cattle-fattening project in her house to use the milk and make cheese for her household and sell the rest. 

The project became very successful, and she wants to expand it, so she requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ramon es un grupo nuevo, donde las mujeres se unieron para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias. Son 25 mujeres que están luchando para ser alguien en la vida, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hermenegilda quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras varias que viene haciendo, está luchando para poder dar a su familia los ingresos para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group named San Ramon is a new group, where women united themselves to be able to grow and help their families. They are 25 women who are fighting to be someone in life, they are in the poverty elimination program to be able to improve their living conditions. One of the group members is Hermenegilda, who through effort and continuous work, and by selling various fruits and vegetables, is striving to be able to give her family income for a dignified life without deprivation. 

She requests this loan to be able to buy fresh fruits and vegetables, so that in this way she will be able to continue growing her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son 17 mujeres que están haciendo el programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Guiselda, ella es comerciante de mandioca, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. Ella es un modelo de vida a seguir, ayuda a sus compañeras en motivaciones y en acompañamiento dentro del grupo realizando actividades de integración.
La Sra. Guiselda solicita este préstamo para la compra de mandioca en cantidad, para poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchar a la vez para dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras is in its fourth cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them are working and helping each other to get ahead.  There are 17 women who are in the elimination of poverty program in order to be able to improve.

Guiselda is one of the members.  She sells cassava.  On her last survey she was at a level one level of poverty.  That is to say that she lives in extreme poverty.  She is a model to follow in life.  She helps her colleagues with motivation and by joining them in outreach activities. 

Guiselda is requesting this loan to buy cassava in bulk in order to be able to continue with her sales and to struggle to give her family everything that she was not able to have.

loans.use: to buy cassava in bulk.

loans.name: Meloma

texts.en:
Meloma is 61 years old and married with 6 children.  She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Meloma needs a loan to buy boots, a spade, chemicals, a new pitch-fork, crops and a machete. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Meloma will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy boots, a spade, chemicals, a new pitch-fork, crops and a machete

loans.name: Beato Roque González De Santacruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Beato Roque González de Santacruz está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, cada una es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Se destaca la Sra. Myrian quien es una muy buena modista, es una mujer muy trabajadora que se ha hecho conocida por su buena labor. Comenta que se ha abierto camino para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella quiere poder seguir con su trabajo y su esfuerzo diario.
texts.en:
The group Beato Roque González de Santacruz  is in its 4th loan cycle with the Women's Committee program. Each member is putting forth her best effort to support her family and loved ones. Each one is hardworking and willing to sacrifice. 

Myrian stands out as a dressmaker. She is a hardworking woman who is known for the quality of her work. She comments that a path has opened for her to help her family and loved ones, giving them what she was not able to have. Myrian is requesting this loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, rubber bands, and other items that will allow her to continue her work. She hopes to be able to keep working and giving her best effort each day.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, rubber bands, and other items.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, y comenta que su meta es poder recibirse de abogada, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de derecho.
Comenta que pone todo su esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su hijo darle una vida digna sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y con ello poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Liliana is from the city of San Ignacio. She is a single mother of one child. She comments that her goal is to graduate as a lawyer so she is studying Law. She says that she puts all her effort into being able to help her son and give him a dignified life without hardships. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for the cost of her degree so she can cover this expense.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her degree.
